20337342.review:
Face palm knowing that https://www.artifexmundi.com/page/news/ these people have decided to jump on the bioshock hype.

This is a HOG game with a variety of other puzzles, none too difficult and a few quite fun. The biggest difference is that if you don't like hidden object finds, you can instead click on a set of three dominoes and play dominoes instead where the hidden object puzzles are. The dominoe puzzles are easy and impossible to fail even for a deliquent, drunk and blindfolded. In fact it was so easy i'm not actually sure why they would put it in there as it seems almost a waste of time.

Story is all over the place just a rushed quick cash grab concoction. Some experimental underwater city called Eden was made. Eventually the peaceful city becomes traumatised by legates, ghostly dark hooded grim reaper high priest style dressed beings that float around the place. Half way in the game you find that the legates all listen to the dark lord which I assume is satan and they tie people up in trees and possess them for no reason what so ever.

In the end you approach the dark lord with a golden arrow, he grabs it off you and breaks it and throws it back at you. You put it back together and stick it in him... he dies. Never knew Satan was such a dumb dumb.

I must say I didn't really appreciate the nonsensical supernatural theme running throughout and made the game just feel like a cheap cash in.

While the music and sounds are great and there are enough cheap scares in this to have you spitting your crisps your eating at the monitor at various locations. (Turn sound up) The voice acting and some of the dialogues are so cheesy and poorly done youll be uncontrollably head shaking like your at a rock concert.

For achievement hunters place the game on easy and DO NOT HIT HINT BUTTON that will at least save you from two more walk throughs. Unfortunately you will have to play through again playing dominoes instead. Play each Hidden Object map leaving the last object of each map unfound and just hit the dominoe set to finish of each map on a single dominoe. This is the quickest way to get 100%.

Nice animation, music and sound. Terrible, poorly done story with hidden supernatural themes (skip button was welcoming here). Game is no where near worth $10.00.

So devs what are you going to rip off next? Borderlands? Alien Isolation? ARK?

20291488.review:
Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden,中文译名：深渊：伊甸的幽灵
Artifex的一款老作品，伊甸在圣经中代表了亚当和夏娃初始居住之乐园，然而当伊甸园毁灭的时候，亚当和夏娃又当何去何从呐？
  从那过场动画中人物嘴动其他地方不动的那一刻我就明白了这绝对是一款和时间之谜1代同时期的作品，而且最为恶意的是本作又该死的没有地图移动功能，我通关的20%时间都花在了地图移动上面，尤其是那个电梯。而且本作一样有着外传成就+寻物/小游戏成就，间接拖延了很长一段时间，幸亏没学时间之谜1弄那么多的寻物，如果真的把两者的糟粕合在一起，那真的会让成就党们砸电脑的。
  中途看到要寻找的教授图片的时候我惊呆了，你确实这位不是乌鸦森林之谜1&2里面的牧师BOSS么？虽然同是一个公司的产品，但你这么照搬好么，不管谁先谁后，都让我产生了人物感观偏差。男主角实在太没有什么存在感最后还摆出一副高姿态要和女主角结婚，你这是傲娇么？
  Artifex那个套用模板不想用了，就这么的了吧

遊戲性本身還不錯，部分關卡設的很有挑戰性
以尋找物件來講也有替代方案（旁邊的連連看（？）
但是遊戲中非隱藏物件的畫面點擊不是很精準

線索充足，道具的運用還算直觀沒有太令人匪夷所思的地方　

畫面上雖說不是最精緻的，但水準還是很高
而且動畫的部分相比起其他類似的遊戲更是好

至於劇情上，有很多不合理的地方，結合番外來看也ry
尤其結局太突兀，避免劇透就不贅述了.....

若對這個遊戲有興趣，建議還是打折時入手好

20190349.review:
First: I have never thought that I would review this kind of game. These game are not my kind of choice.
Second: I have bought this in bundle for 1$.

From what I see here on Steam, this game is called Hidden objects game - HOG. I know this kind of games as "adventures" here where I live. You simply collect things (sometimes finding them along other useless crap) and combine them together to advance in the game.

I have finished the game in less than 6 hours on Expert difficulty which is still easy enough - given that I'm no expert in this field.

The game looks really good, riddles and puzzles are challenging but not over the top. Anyone with a bit of memory and intelligence should finish the game easily. If you lower the difficulty, the game does everything for you (no enjoyment).

For the price (1/3$) this game is a gem I like to have in my library. Having said that I don't like this kind of games, I enjoyed the playthrough and I would recommend the game to anyone.

If you read this before January 7th 2016, you can grab the game in Indiegala Riddles bundle for the lowest possible price.

And one more thing - Runs perfectly on Linux (Intel i915 graphics).

19943165.review:
Once again, after playing the second 9 clues game, I'm gonna say that it was pretty fun and did a good job of combining the two, as I assume all of these games do. However, there are couple of flaws that make this not the best in the series I'm sure. For one, there isn't as many puzzles in this one as there were in 9 clues and they did repeat a couple of them which kinda lessens the uniqueness of the game. The animation is also comically worse than 9 clues seeing as most of the time the lip movements are so robotic they look like stop motion. The story has an interesting setting with interesting enemies but you don't have many encounters with them like you did in 9 clues. The thing that actually got me the most was the ending of the game which was extrememly disappointing. It includes a statue of seems to be cythulu....and you end up beating the main boss after magically repairing the weapon that he just broke in half....and then seemingly waving it in front of him. Seriously, they never show you stabing him or anything you just wave it around and he's like "No, it's possible!" and he dies. If this were a movies I honestly would have smashed it to bits but because it's a video game I let it off a bit because the story isn't the only focus.
I would say that if your already a fan of the series then go ahead and buy the game preferably in a bundle because I really think that this one isn't worth the price tag like 9 clues was. If you're a newcomer to the series, please god do not start with this one. I'm only recommending this game because it isn't bad game it's just bad in comparison to 9 clues.

19836178.review:
This is a nice hidden object game. The puzzles are good. Graphics are solid for this genre. Locations are really interesting. It's an underwater city. I was waiting for a Big Daddy to drill me to death at any moment! 

Everything is easily identified, but not easy to find. All the puzzles require you to use some objects in the scene to uncover others. The puzzles that aren't hidden object games are fairly easy compared to other games in this genre, but they are of nice variety. 

It took about 3.5 hours to complete the game. The story is okay, nothing memorable, nothing bad. My only gripe with this game is the movement system. You have to go from room to room, backtracking often, sometimes through a half dozen screens. I've played a number of other hidden object games that allow faster travel by selecting locations on the map, so this felt like a step back from that convenience.

19767020.review:
Artiflex Mundi have really got this hidden object/point and click adventure style nailed down. Yes they've stolen almost the entire style and location from bioshock, but they have a variety of puzzles and locations which are generally interesting and intuitive.

Only real criticism would be the rendering of some of the characters and the voice acting. Greg has the cold emotionless stare of a velociraptor, and the protagonist sounds like she's permanently bored with the whole thing, but not a bad game overall.

19674550.review:
Tu marido hizo una inmersión con carácter de investigación, pero pasan las horas y no ha regresado. Te toca a ti, su mujer, adentrarte en las profundidades marínas y descubrir el misterio de su desaparación.

Así empieza este genial point & click con los típicos minijuegos de buscar objetos. 

Me han gustado mucho sus rompecabezas, muy injeniosos y no muy difíciles. La ambinetación es de lo mejor. Recuerda perfectamente a los primeros Bioshock una ciudad subamarina en caos. Al tratarse de un point and click su apartado artistico debe destacar y este lo ha hecho, muy sobresaliente, mucho colorido.

Las animaciones fáciales de los personajes son lo peor que he visto en toda mi vida, es entendible, este tipo de juego se desarrollan por un grupo reducido de gente, como principal plataforma las redes sociales como Facebook y dispositivos móviles.

Su historia me parecia interesante al principio pero, a lo largo de la aventura me dejó de interesar, empezó a cobrar un tono demasiado fantasioso y me descolocó demasiado con lo que, perdí un poco el interes.

Es un gran juego para descansar de otros títulos más exigentes mentalmente, altamente recomendable por debajo de los 5€.

19394972.review:
За любимым хоть в огонь, хоть в воду.  Когда жених героини пропал, Мэри ни на секунду не подумала, что, может быть, это он придумал такой экзотический способ избежать свадьбы. Она отправляется туда, где этот горе-Индиана Джонс проводил свои исследования и находит подводный город Эдем, построенный в стиле стимпанк и вызывающий ассоциации с небесным городом из Bioshock Infinite. Похоже, когда-то Эдем был утопией, теперь же утопия разве что от слова «утонуть». На первый взгляд город пуст. Но в затопленных уголках действует враждебная сила из глубин, подсылающая к Мэри своих делегатов… То есть легатов. Это духи в балахонах, которых она первоначально принимала за галлюцинации.  И лишь следы ее дорогого Роберта вроде ласты в кустах побуждают ее идти вперед разгадывать тайны Эдема. 

Итак, перед нами квест. Т.е. игра, показывающая, что проблемы решаются не только с помощью дробовика X-300d «Клеймор». Если понять взаимосвязь вещей, разгадать головоломки, задействовать логику, то можно сделать больше полезного, чем отряд спецназа. 

Игра сделана качественно, не халтурно. Головоломки интересные и разнообразные. В иных местах надо отыскивать предметы с помощью фонарика, в иных – под водой.  В одном месте в некотором роде все это сразу.  И недостаточно порой кликнуть по загаданному предмету в сцене поиска. Требуется провести какие-то манипуляции.  Например,  «кипящая вода». Нужно взять банку с водой, перелить в колбу на спиртовке, найти спичку и зажечь. Нужные вещи героиня добывает не только в сценах поиска. Они могут быть невзначай запрятаны на местности. Не хочется копаться в куче хлама в поисках предметов? Вместо этого можно сыграть в мини-игру домино. Словом, прохождение не доставит трудностей, если вы, конечно, не поставили сразу уровень сложности эксперт.  А еще можно распугивать рыбок курсором  аж в меню игры.

В промежутках между очередным складыванием пазла, обнаруженного в кейсе, и  восстановлением энергоснабжения, можно наблюдать ролики, скажем так, жутковатые. Как же надо верить, что amor vincit omnia (любовь побеждает все), чтобы выхватить ключ из хладных скрюченных лап  чудовища в балахоне, до этого пугавшего героиню надписями в лифте! Главный демон силен, но он еще не знал столь неустрашимого противника: девушку, которая хочет выйти замуж. 

Из минусов, мне не слишком понравилось, что игровой процесс из исследования подводного города превращается в обрывание лепесточков и проведение мистических ритуалов. В других обзорах ее упрекают в банальности. Но мне полузатопленный город, захваченный злыми силами, и интерпретация образа Эдема кажутся достаточно оригинальными. Взять, например, символ зеленого дерева, на который героиня то и дело натыкается. Явный намек на древо познания добра и зла. Но в Библии Эдем – райский сад, а древо…  не то чтобы ключ к погибели, но вроде того. В игре все наоборот: Эдем – кошмар, а дерево – символ прекрасного. 

Может, вместо банальности лучше говорить о предсказуемости сюжета и т.д. Но таковы законы жанра. Самое главное здесь – головоломки, которые игрок не спеша в свое удовольствие разгадывает и тем снимает стресс.
 
ЗЫ: На заметку. Спасение парня из лап демона, - явно более хороший способ «проверить отношения», чем какое-нибудь сожительство до брака.

19328087.review:
“So what should we make our next game about?”

“I have a great idea! The protagonist finds themselves in an underwater Art Deco city that was supposed to be a utopian society but it has collapsed and it is now mostly deserted and...”

“Let me stop you there Clive, that's the plot of BioShock.”

“No it is completely different! Because… because… umm… umm… err... Daemons! Yes daemons the city has been taken over by daemons!”

Well at least that is how I image this game was conceived. It is so obviously inspired by BioShock that is suffers for it as it is just pale in comparison. The story is disappointing and reaches a very anticlimactic ending. The voice acting is mostly okay but there is one jarring bit where a character thanks you for saving him again as though he is thanking you for making a cup of tea.

This doesn't measure up to other Artifex Mundi games but I'm still going to give this a thumbs up as the art work, hidden objects scenes and puzzles are just what I've come to expect and the visuals are a bit better than some of the others I have played.

19113170.review:
Игра "Бездна: духи Эдема" от студии Artifex Mundi, как и все игры в таком жанре простая во всём. Здесь очень банален сюжет, загадки хоть и интересные, но простые и пропусткать их не имеет смысла, музыка не навязчивая и приятная.

СЮЖЕТ

Мы играем за молодую девушку, которая ищет своего парня ( а не наоборот как в описании игры ) и поиски приводят её в этот самый город, Эдем. На пути нам встречается непонятная девочка которая от нас убегает, а позже мы встречаем самого "духа". В общем это всё что можно сказать. Концовка как и сам сюжет, банальна.

ПЛЮСЫ И МИНУСЫ 

+ Легко выбить все достижения ( требуется 2 прохождения ).

+ Музыка и звуки не на высоте, но ушам  приятно.

+ Простота, не надо по полчаса думать "что и куда".

+ Коллекционные карточки. Куда-же без них.

+ Брнусы после прохождения игры ( особенно предыстория города )


- Очень банален сюжет и концовка.

- Высокая цена для такой игры ( советую брать только со скидкой )

ВЫВОД

Это игра как я называю "на один вечер" ( если не выбивать все достижения ), простая и понятная для всех.
Моя оценка игре 7/10

18796115.review:
[b]Spielwertung:[/b] 6,5/10

7 Stunden und 2 1/2 Durchläufe später. Was soll ich sagen? Eigene Unfähigkeit. 

[b]Spieldauer:[/b] ca. 2 bis 3 Stunden für einen Durchgang auf höchstem Schwierigkeitsgrad

+ leichter bis mittlerer Schwierigkeitsgrad 
+ gut erreichbare Errungenschaften (erfordern aber ein zweites Mal durchspielen)
+ alternativ zum Beenden der Wimmelbildszenen kann man diese durch Domino lösen (für die Errungenschaften benötigt man aber beides)
+ Bonusabenteuer (ca. 1 Stunde)
+ schöner Grafikstil mit teilweise hübschen Unterwassergebieten

- viele Jumpscares (die nicht wirklich erschrecken)
- keine Schnellreisefunktion
- Fahrstuhlfahrten ohne Übersprungmöglichkeit

[b]Zusammenfassung/Kommentar:[/b] 

Ein gutes Spiel aus dem Hause Artifex Mundi. Wer schon einige Spiele von diesem Entwickler gespielt hat, wird auch dieses mit hoher Wahrscheinlichkeit mögen. Vertraute Steuerung und Funktionen machen es nicht schwer in das Spiel einzutauchen. 

Die Errungenschaften sind fast alle gut zu erreichen. „Tempostrecke“ bildet hier eine Ausnahme, die nicht ganz so einfach war. (Ein Dominospiel in unter einer Minute abschließen.)  Man kann diese Errungenschaft aber auch mit Trick 17 erledigen. Bei Interesse einfach mal einen Guide auf Steam lesen, da wird diese Möglichkeit erörtert. 

Die Wimmelbilder befinden sich in der Regel auf einem guten Level: nicht zu schwer aber auch nicht zu einfach. 

Wer Spiele von Artifex Mundi kennt, wird in den Minispielen auf vertraute Thematik treffen. Schwierigkeitsgrad liegt zwischen leicht und mittel. Sind in der Regel gut lösbar, es gibt aber auch ein paar, wo man eventuell etwas länger knobeln muss. 

Schade finde ich, dass hier auf eine Schnellreisefunktion verzichtet wurde, besonders in Verbindung mit den unvermeidbaren Fahrstuhlfahrten. Gelegentlich muss man mit einem Fahrstuhl in andere Ebene fahren und ich bin diese Szenen sehr schnell leid gewesen. Ich denke, das dürfte für die Meisten aber ein erträglicher Makel sein. 

Jumpscares sind auch in Wimmelbildspielen nichts Neues mehr. Dieses Spiel hat wirklich viele eingebaut, die nur leider nicht funktionieren und daher von mir eher müde belächelt wurden. 

[b][i]Fazit:[/i][/b] Gutes und solides Wimmelbildspiel mit ganz kleinen Makeln. Leider war es jedoch eins der Spiele von Artifex Mundi, welches mich nicht so sehr fesseln konnte. Ohne das ich sagen kann warum. Verkehrt macht das Spiel nicht viel, die Story ist passabel, die Grafik gut und dennoch ... Der Zeitraum den ich benötigt habe, um „Abyss: The Wraiths from Eden“ zu vervollständigen spricht für sich. Nicht desto trotz bleibt es für mich ein gutes Spiel, das eine Empfehlung verdient hat.

18736153.review:
Yet another utopian society gone awry, this time due to human curiosity. (Though Pandora was not the one who opened the box this time.)

Storyline: Marine explorer Robert stumbles upon an underwater city.  Before being able to report his finding he is taken captive by a mysterious entity with glowing red eyes in a black robe.  After not returning from his dive, his female companion sets out to find him.  She follows his underwater trail to the underwater city of Eden.  Once inside she discovers the ruins of a once magnificent underwater utopian metropolis build to seek harmony and peace.  Her mission: Find Robert and along the way she discovers there are others still alive in this decaying city.  Some are survivors, some are rebels, and some are possessed.  Second mission: Escape.   (Any more storyline would spoil the mystery and adventure.) 

Reveiwers have blasted this game (circa 2012) for various things but the biggest complaint seems to be is it is a rip-off of Bioshock.  I have never played Bioshock so for me it was fresh and I did not compare two entirely different types of games with entirely different storyline concepts.  Besides anything written about any underwater utopia, if one wants to get technical, is a rip-off of Jules Verne's "Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea" and "Mysterious Island" or even Dr. No (the movie) of the James Bond franchise originally authored by Ian Fleming. 

Gameplay: Beyond the jump scares and the death count, (both of which should be expected due to what occurred in the storyline), the game plays in a sectional linear fashion with a find and use inventory that needs to be completed before being able to move into the next section/area.  The storyline is revealed through discovery as the gamer explores the complex.  Generally there is little backtracking but some items found in some areas can not be used until later in the game.  (So if playing on expert mode remember where there are.)   The Hidden Object scenes are scattered throughout and for the most part are only played once.  There are several times where the same scene is played twice but generally only after the gamer has progressed the storyline.  Certain Hidden Object scenes (generally a replay scene) and certain items only show up after the game progresses.  If stuck in an area that means something has not been done yet.

There is a lot of point and click hunt, find and solve to this game.  In my opinion this game leans toward point and click with Hidden Object finds as a secondary.  Which oddly enough works well with the storyline.  The same can be said for the puzzles, despite how random they seem.  The puzzles overall are fairly easy to solve and the usual fare.  However the puzzles work well for where they are, what needs to be done, and how they fit into the storyline.  So overall the continuity remains pretty much in tact.  

Final note:  In Artifex Mundi tradition, the Hidden Object scenes can be played with an alternative game.  In this case, it is dominoes.  Added 12/12/2015:  Here is a trick to getting the 1 minute time in the dominoes game: Play the Hidden Object scene as List find.  Play until only one List find clue is left then switch to the dominoes game.  Finish the dominoes game and walla achievement earned.

Overall, I liked the tight well-written storyline, which though a bit far-fetched is no better or worse then most "sci-fi horror" flicks, shows or books.  Oh last thing, there is a rather awkward proposal of marriage at the end which I thought I should mention being such a rare occurence in any game and gives this game a very personal touch.

18561940.review:
[i]"Abyss : Les spectres d'Eden"[/i] fait partie de ces jeux d'objets cachés / puzzles qui tentent avec plus ou moins de bonheur de se prendre pour des jeux d'aventure. Il n'est ni meilleur ni pire que ce qui se fait habituellement dans le genre dirons nous. Plutôt dans la moyenne. Alors pourquoi une éval négative demanderez vous?

Parce qu'ici la traduction française est absolument [b]dé-gueu-lasse[/b]!
Pour vous donner une idée de la qualité de la traduction de ce titre, la 1ere cinématique  vous accueille avec un bouton "saut" incrusté en dessous [i](qui signifie apparemment "passer" dans le contexte)[/i]. La VF des sous titres comme de l'interface sont très approximatives, mais ça n'empêche pas de jouer - par contre, là où ça devient inexusable, c'est quand des erreurs se glissent dans les listes d'objets à trouver :
Quand on vous demandera de trouver un "filet", vous découvrirez qu'il fallait en fait cliquer sur du "fil" en bobines –  "raine" c'est une grenouille (rainette j'imagine, sauf qu'il manque 3 lettres) - et si vous bloquez en cherchant la "balance", il s'agit ici d'une tête de poisson. (Une sorte de sardine O_o  là j'ai même pas compris comment ils ont pu aboutir à cette "traduction".)
Bref, catastrophique & handicapant.

[i](Une autre chose qui m'a personnellement bien agacée : L'utilisation trop abusive de jumpscares tout le long du jeu... -_-' Extrêmement mal dosé et fort pénible à la longue. Donc si comme moi vous détestez ça, vous êtes prévenu(e) qu'il y en aura un paquet à supporter. )[/i]

Mentionnons quand même quelques trucs positifs, car il y en a : Les environnements sont jolis, (un plagiat éhonté de Bioshock, mais passons) - les mini jeux sont aussi plaisants que dans la plupart des titres du genre, et on le trouve souvent bradé à un prix ridicule...

Bref. Personnellement je trouve la traduction tellement inadmissible pour un jeu dont le gameplay est basé sur son texte, qu'il ne mérite clairement pas d'éval positive de la part du public francophone tant qu'Artifex Mundi n'aura pas patché la VF de son jeu. (Et ça n'arrivera sans doute jamais : ça aurait déjà été fait depuis longtemps pour un jeu de 2012).

Pour autant, il serait mesquin de prétendre que le rapport qualité prix est malhonnête pour un titre chopé en solde à 2€. Et ce n'est heureusement pas trop risqué de tenter le coup à ce tarif là si vous aimez le genre (...et que vous supportez qu'on vous formule des devinettes de façon complètement erronée).

18531447.review: Petit jeu d'objets cachés sympa à jouer, sans prise de tête. Acheté en promo et qui m'a occupée une quinzaine d'heures. L'histoire est basique mais l'ambiance est bien rendue, les jeux d'objets cachés sont classiques mais amusants.

18525155.review:
Прекрасное, пусть и короткое приключение, которое займёт вас на 3,5-4 часа. История, хоть и использует достаточно банальные ходы, тем не менее выглядит очень интересно - такая антиутопия о том, во что обернулся райский подводный город, где обещали свободу и счастье всем и каждому. Жаль, что тема в игре раскрывается недостаточно полно: бонусная история от лица жителя города слишком короткая, не успеваешь полностью погрузиться в атмосферу этого места. Но даже то, что есть, сделано прекрасно: локации подводного города прорисованы отлично, в игре множество пугающих моментов, ролики, как всегда, на высоте. В общем, не игра, а сплошное удовольствие, я бы с удовольствием поиграла в продолжение или ещё лучше - в приквел. 
Крайне рекомендую фанатам жанра.

P. S. В тексте описания говорится о пропавшей невесте, тогда как играем мы за девушку и ищем своего возлюбленного - это косяк перевода.

Auf der Suche nach einem verschwundenen Freund entdeckst Du ein versunkenes Reich mit fantastischen,mystischen, unglaublichen Orten und Charakteren.

Auf deiner Reise gibt es viele Rätsel und Wimmelbilder zu entdecken, diese gibt es widerum zu lösen, um hinter das Geheimnis einer unheimlichen Macht zu kommen, die hier herrscht und den vermissten Freund sowie die Bewohner der Unterwasser-Stadt zu retten.

Das Spiel hat insgesamt 3 Schwierigkeitsgrade: leicht, normal und schwer,diese zeigen sich wie folgt: Höherer Schwierigkeitsgrad bedeutet weniger inaktive Hilfe im Spiel wo man bekommen kann. An der Geschichte ändert sich daran aber nichts. 
Davon kann auch die Gesamtspielzeit abhängig sein. Auf Leicht hat diese zwischen 5- 6 Stunden bei mir gedauert.  

Wie von Artifex-Mundi gewöhnt hat man mit " Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden" wieder ein schönes, spannendes und gut inszeniertes Wimmelbild-Abenteuer abgeliefert.

18192811.review:
The first time I've played this game was around the beginning of summer, looking for a decent HOG to spare the day for. As a HOG lover, I can most assuredly say that Artifex Mundi has always presented me the best examples of the genre, and [i]Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden[/i] is no exception.

The story is about an underwater city established to seek "Enlightenment", mysterious wraiths called as "legates" taking control over the city, a limited number of survivors forming a resistance against them, and our poor, frustrated main character who is only there to look for her missing husband. Yes, the plot practically screams the [i]Call of Cthulhu[/i] meets [i]Bioshock[/i], but the game manages to handle a cliché combination to craft a refreshing setting quite well. As any other Artifex Mundi game, the curtain opens up to an elaborate chaos which could only be sustained by our puzzle solving and item collecting genius.

Story and environment, with well-made artwork as always, are interesting enough to keep you going until you complete the game, which can be said for a select few games in this genre. There is a common formula for crafting HOGs which never fails: pick a mystery, add a missing person or at least a high stake, stir the pot with some HOG scenes and offer a complimentary cheesy ending. In our case, it comes with Artifex Mundi caliber artwork. All checked, we are ready to go!

Hidden Object scenes are decent, puzzles are fairly simple and adventure elements are easy to track down with the aid of your map. What I'd like to take a note of, is that item usage and combinations actually make sense too! Playing dominos as an alternative to Hidden Object scenes is creative and entertaining. Oh, and it is possible to finish the game without the aid of any kind of manual or walkthrough.

If you like the genre, or maybe the game is on sale, buy it already! It's Artifex Mundi. It basically cannot be bad. If you've played [i]Bioshock[/i], you'll be having a small voice in your head, whispering: "laaaaame", but you'll still play it out of curiosity. You are facing another beyond par HOG, so you are welcome!

Please also check out Lady Storyteller's Curator page [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/11672469/]here[/url] - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games!

And also Lady Storyteller's HOG Gems [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/27766387/]here[/url] - for casual games and HOGs you may enjoy!

18183726.review: I'm a fan of Artifex Mundi. Their games look great, have some nice variety, and are as long as they need to be. I wasn't a huge fan of the story, but the visuals spice it up a lot. If you want something relaxing, fairly easy, but still satisfying, this game will do the trick. I'd wait for it to go on sale, though. $10 for a game you may spend 5 hours to beat and never play again is a bit much.

18160072.review:
Firstly, I must admit I was spoiled by playing "Nightmares from the Deep 2: The Siren`s Call" first. The 3D renders aren't as smooth and you can't use the map to jump to locations. One thing it doesn't have like that game - thankfully - is no collectibles to find along the way.

Apart from the odd 3D, it's mostly a good looking, nice sounding game with decent puzzles. It's really hard for me to articulate any particularly good parts so I have to indulge in some criticism.

There are 2 sections that involve moving around objects that are weird and unintuitive. Too many pieces, too many large pieces and pieces will often jump back or lie somewhere close.

Elevator gets annoying. You have to stop at each floor, waiting a second or so for the door to open till you can continue. Particularly weird is that you can't control its direction so at one point in order to go up 1 floor, you need to go down first then up 2 floors. Aestetically annoying is that you can't shut the panel once you've fixed it...

Story seemed dubious at first but does gets explained near the end.

Jump scares not particularly scary for me, especially the first one.

Some hidden object clues are'nt clear but that's to be expected. One I really didn't approve of was "sugar bowl". I did an Image Search for that and it did NOT come up. What it should have been is "sugar dispenser".

Some achievements mean you'll have to play the game at least twice: once for the hidden objects and once for the dominos. Both times on Expert Mode. Else, like me, you'll have to play it about 5 times.

Speaking of Expert mode, Hiding HO areas is cruel especially considering they're repeated in some. Also for the reason that some interactive areas are just for flavour text. In fact, one is repeated AND has flaour text. I had to use the hint twice because there's no logical reason to go back a specific area and click on it again, especially if it's not nearby.

I managed to get all the achievements in 8 hours without a walkthrough so I'm satisfied with that.

18134187.review:
I don't have anything against this sort of game really. Hidden Object games are a fun casual experience from time to time. My problem with the endless flood of these things on steam is that they aren't very good. The art is nice (barring the characters themselves) and the object finding is good enough but each game lacks anything to make it stand out from the others. 

The best Hidden Object games in my mind remain the I-Spy ones, Treasure Hunt and Haunted House in-particular. They had simple goals but they were fun to pursue. Each Hidden object was a good time and clicking on things made them animate and made a simple game that much more entertaining. In this game everything just fades out of existence when you click on it. This makes each puzzle a chore instead of an experience. 

The I-Spy games were also made or kids in mind so the goals were pretty simple, escape the house, find the treasure etc. However these were fun and relate-able in the sense that they were likely things kids imagined on their own. These games opt for some overly complex bull crap story with no real substance whatsoever. They choose to have characters with backstories and what not and still every one of them feels and sounds entirely disinterested at all times. 

The other big problem I have here is backtracking. Sending the player all over this needlessly large environment to either pick up loose objects or do the same hidden object puzzles with different items to find. In I-Spy backtracking was done once at the end of the game to find hidden clues inside each puzzle that linked together. This was a really cool reason to backtrack because it meant the treasure, key, or whatever had been in plain sight all along. Here its just another chore to get another item so i can proceed to go to another puzzle.

Plus as far as this story goes... I defeated the dumb evil sea monster by literally messing up his drawing on the floor. That's what we call a payoff right there.

17853268.review:
Despite having the most absurd story of them all, Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden is my favourite HO game of the same developer. Like the others, it is graphically very beautiful, and the story is somewhat silly.
Yet the female protagonist this time seems to have a spark of initiative the others geneally lack. It is refreshing to see a female protagonist save her male counterpart and everyone else.
In a perfect balance between all the things that make HO games fun and what makes the utterly horrible games, this one has a good enough story, a good enough scenario, and lacks all the things that make the other games so terribly annoying, like horrible voice acting, a stupid character or the solution to the puzzles too obvious.

Not extremely long, but I got a nice kick out of this one, and a somewhat satisfactory sensation when it was over. This one is worth buying. Maybe for a discount, but go for it.

17813525.review:
Abyss will seem very familiar to a lot of us, there is clearly a lot borrowed from Rapture (Bioshock) in terms of the scenario and even the look and feel of Eden and the fall of a supposed libertarian/freedom enclave under the sea into a supernatural fascist police state - and then it gets worse. The storyline at least is somewhat different from its thematic inspiration, so it doesn't feel like a complete retread.

In terms of gameplay the HOG scenes all play fine, and the puzzles were also pretty good - a reasonable mix and a moderate difficulty in most cases, and the point and click sections in between it all works well enough, nothing too illogical or jarring, and of course the HOG genre fits quite well into this semi-apocalyptic scenario of scavenging around for tools and clues as to what is happening. An alternative to playing the HOG scenes - dominos - is available, although it is pretty bland, and it seems a bit odd when these sorts of things are provided, as it seems unlikely there is big market of people that would play a HOG if the HOG scenes weren't there, as they tend to make pretty weak point and click puzzlers with this part taken away. 

As has been mentioned in other reviews, one of the weaknesses here is the animations when characters are talking to you which makes them look like mannequins (although due to they story in a few cases this is somewhat appropriate), which is a bit jarring. Another minor issue is that the achievements are set up so you have to play the game twice - once doing only HOG scenes, once playing Dominos at each such scene, in order to get 100%. 

However in summary this is a well made, if derivative, game that is easy to play, mildly challenging in places, and with an okay storyline and atmosphere.

17563508.review:
Dalsi povedena adventura od Artifex Mundi a znovu drzi sve kvality. Tentokrat v podmorskem prostredi tajemneho mesta. O tom by se dalo asi nejvic diskutovat. Hra je sice krasne nakreslena, ale je to stylem fakt brutalni kopie Bioshocku od 2K Games. Docela by me zajimalo, jestli to nenarusuje nejaka prava :) Ale co, pro hrace je to jen plus. 
Zachranujete sveho snoubence ze sparu prizraku, ktere jsou ovladany mocnym demonem. Grafika je velmi povedena a atmosfericka, 16:9, dokonce i videosceny jsou celkem fajn. Az na rozhovory s postavami - ty dostaly neprirozene prkenne obliceje, kterym se casto hybou jen usta a pusobi to docela amatersky. Kdyby udelali rozhovory s celou postavou, ne jen "obliceji", pusobilo by to myslim lip. 
Hadanky jsou opet dost jednoduche (zase ruzne posouvani a skladani) a doufam, ze uz autori nebudou dale zlehcovat. Sice je fajn, ze minihry nebrzdi tempo, ale i na expertni obtiznost (je za to achiev.) je hra docela snadna. Hidden object screeny (HOS) jsou prehledne a dobre prokreslene a daji se nahradit hrou s dominem. S tim souvisi opet moje vytka vuci achievementum. Nesnasim, kdyz kvuli 100% musim adventuru dohravat 2x (jednou s HOS, jednou s dominy). Hra je porad stejna, takze je to dost nuda (to neni jak RPGcko, kde si clovek aspon muze pokazde udelat jinou postavu). Take jezdeni vytahem ve hre bylo trochu otravne, jelikoz jsem neprisel na to, jak se posunout naraz o dve patra (presouvani pres mapu chybi, skoda). 
A posledni vytka je hlavne pro znalce dalsich her od Artifex, hlavne prvniho dilu "Enigmatis". Jedna z postav jakoby z oka vypadla kazateli z Maple Creek. Take lokace se stromem, kde je i vzhledove podobna hadanka jako v Enigmatis, jakoby odkazovala na tuto hru. Coz ale vubec nedava smysl. Nenapada me jedina mozna souvislost mezi temito hrami, a tak tyto "easter-eggy" zustavaji spis velkou podivnosti. 
Zbytek je ale fajn, postup je logicky a nemel jsem zadny neprijemny zakys. V CE edici navic hrac dostane prequelovou bonusovou kapitolu a jako vzdy wallpapery, OST a dalsi. Pokud si hru stahnete z Alawaru, muzete ji hrat v kvalitnim ceskem prekladu (ale opet, uz je to temer pravidlem, se nevyhli bugum v HOS kvuli vice vyznamum angl. slov, takze napr. misto "prutu" hledejte vetvicku, misto "stetce" kartac nebo misto "vahy" rybi supiny).

70%

17515194.review:
I'm not the sort to prejudice games over things like their being hidden object puzzlers; and the Artifex Mundi games are by far the best examples of the genre. Nonetheless A.M. has followed the method of if it isn't broke don't fix it, meaning they reuse their puzzles with cosmetic variations from one game to another. This has the unfortunate result that if you've played one of their games you've played them all.

That's O.K. if you think of the games as more visual novels with bonus puzzle content. Granted the writing isn't amazing; but it isn't bad either. I know I've yet to play an A.M. game I could make myself stop playing before the end. That's, on average, over 3 hours in one sitting. And, most of their games include a bonus chapter that extends gameplay another hour.

They do manage to do this without unnecessarily padding game length that overstays its welcome. I know that doesn't sound like much in an industry with triple AAA titles that boast hundred of hours of gameplay. But, for cheap casual games this is an achievement.

My recommendation, because of the "if you've played one you've played them all" problem, is pare your selections down to their better games. That would be Enigmatis 2 (but not the mediocre Enigmatis: the Ghosts of Maple Creek) as a top pick, Grim Legends 1 & 2 if you liked that, and the Nightmares from the Deep trilogy if you just can't get enough of these games.

O jogo é bom. Tem uma boa jogabilidade, boa história, bons puzzles, bons gráficos. Embora algumas falhas irritantes, como erros terríveis na tradução e algumas cenas que fazem a história parecer bem café com pão, o jogo vale apena se você gosta de point n' click e está procurando um jogo diferente.

A história poderia ser melhor? Sim, poderia... mas não é tão ruim, e depois nos "extras" você ainda pode jogar uma outra história e descobrir o que realmente aconteceu antes de tudo aquilo, o que exatamente era aquele lugar, e ter um ponto de vista diferente, através de outro personagem.

Quanto aos sustos... eu só me assustei uma ou duas vezes no máximo, então não espere algo assustador, é muito mais suspense. E nada que te deixe realmente com medo.

Os puzzles seguem os já clássicos e conhecidos puzzles de todo jogo do estilo, não vi muita coisa nova, diferente, mas são bem elaborados. Alguns são até difíceis, se você não cometer o pecado de jogar no modo iniciante.

Eu daria nota 6... talvez 7 se eu estiver em um dia bom.

17309314.review:
"Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden" is pretty much your standard Artifex Mundi casual adventure Hidden Object Game (HOG).  The graphics are fairly nice, the story is trite but adequate, the voice acting is mostly tolerable, the puzzles enjoyable, and the Steam Achievements a bit irritating.  If you've played any Artifex Mundi HOGS, there's nothing unexpected.  Really, the only minor negatives are those Steam Achievements:  the HOG and the Dominoes Achievements are mutually exclusive.  So, to get 100% Achievements, you're forced to do two run-throughs.  And, as usual, since there are no saves, if you mess up, you have to finish that run-through regardless and then do it again.  One thing to point out with this game (like a lot of these HOGs) is that it's old enough that the user profile is not saved in the Steam folders or even in the standard Saved Games folder.  Instead, it's saved in the hidden folder [username]\AppData\Roaming\ArtifexMundi\Abyss_TheWraithsOfEden\CE.  So, if you're worried about losing it, make sure you back that up.

I got about 9.6 hours of good game play out of the game (6.5 hours for the first run-through with the Bonus Chapter and another 3.1 hours for the second run-through).  So, even at it's list price, the game is close to being worth it.  Of course, if you can find it on sale (as I did), then go ahead and snap it up.

17148391.review:
Ah well, this is a tough decision. I was baited by the good reviews and the nice looking previews, and as this game was in a bundle, I picked it up for the backlog. Time went by and I got to play it today - and I have to say, it would have definitely not been worth the full price of 8€.

But let's go deeper into it. The game is set in an interesting, haunted, underwater city. You play a woman that tries to find her lost husband, which - if you will - was an underwater-extreme-sport-archeologist-whatever-dude. And that's basically everything for pre-story. The game then throws you with a neat handdrawn cutscene right into it.
It then asks you whether you want to play a short tutorial, which is useless, and then you're on your own - depending on the difficulty you have chosen. 
You'll have to do some "Where's Waldo"-style minigames or can alternatively do some kind of mahjongg-clone, then find some items around the scenes, and do a puzzle here and there. And here and there you'll find another little cutscene.
Storywise the game takes some time to build up and then develops a rather interesting story (which by the way could make for a great FPS à la Bioshock), which unfortunately then cuts off completly at about 95% and abruptly ends the game with a rather boring conclusion and a stupid teaser.

So now that we know about gameplay and story, what about graphics? While you can't expect much from a simple adventure game like this, it's actually drawn very nicely and has some decent detail to it. It is playable on 4:3 and 16:9, but will unfortunately stretch on 21:9. Also, if you have a 4k or QHD-display, you will notice that the game was created for much lower resolutions. But it's not that bad actually and should definitely not be a reason for not buying this.

On for the sound - it's good for the most part, environment sounds are nice, the soundtrack is decent but repeats somewhat to often, and then there's the synchronisation - while the synchro for other characters is ok, that for the player is actually really bad. It sounds like the voice artist went through an emotional drama whether or not she should actually continue voicing the game for the given paycheck. But hey, at least she doesn't talk that often, so that's nice*.


Now the last point - and this is the one why I would not recommend this game for 8€: It's just way to short. You can easily finish this in 3 hours and will probably squeeze no more than 4 hours out of it. Replay value is just not there since the story is completly linear and there's basically nothing you might miss while playing it. 
But if this game is on a sale, you should absolutely grab it, if you're fine with casually playing a point and click adventure. If you're more into FPS like CoD, well, I don't even know why you have read this far.


* Note for feminists and/or anyone else who might feel insulted: This is not meant to be misogynistic but rather as a diss for the actually bad voicing itself. The statement would be the same if it was voiced by a male. Do with this as you will.

Ich spiele total gerne Wimmelbildspiele. Ich hatte mich vorhin noch einmal gefragt warum eigentlich. Ich glaube es liegt daran, dass sie nicht besonders anspruchsvoll sind, aber meistens eine recht interessante Story erzählen. Letzteres ist mir an Spielen soweiso immer am wichtigsten. Zudem ist es so, dass ich täglich sicher 10-12 Stunden arbeite, meistens 6 Tage die Woche und Abends dann keine große Lust mehr habe auf einen AAA Titel, sondern eher noch 1-2 Stunden vor der Daddelkiste entspannen will. Dann kommen solche Wimmelbildspiele immer gut bei mir an, weil sie eben nicht sehr schwer zu lösen sind, ein entspanntes spielen also.

Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden hat mir dabei besonders gut gefallen, weil nicht nur die Story gut erzählt wird, sondern weil sie auch spannend ist. Man will sozusagen die ganze Zeit wissen wie es weitergeht und klickt das Spiel in einem Rutsch durch. Zugegeben, das ist nicht sehr lange, etwa 3 Stunden, aber 3 interessante Stunden. Das Besondere war auch, dass man an einer Stelle irgendwann dachte "Jetzt könnte es zuende sein", also man das Gefühl hatte man ist dem Ende relativ nahe und dann passierte noch einmal was, was man so nicht erahnt hätte und das Spiel wurde dann, obwohl es schon anfing langweilig zu werden, noch einmal sehr spannend. Das Finale wurde dann sozusagen eingeläutet und ab da hatte das Spiel noch einmal richtig Spaß gemacht. Für mich ein Highlight unter den Wimmelbildspielen.

17028317.review:
W Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden wcielamy się w postać kobiety, udającej się na poszukiwania zaginionego męża i nurka, Roberta, który nie powrócił z ekspedycji. Już we wczesnej fazie gry, fabuła intryguje i przykuwa do monitora. Główna bohaterka natrafia na klimatyczne, podwodne miasto, do złudzenia przypominające miejsca znane z gry BioShock. Fabuła jest wciągająca, a ciekawość gracza podnoszą niespodziewane elementy horroru, które pozostawiają uczucie, iż główna bohaterka nie jest sama i czycha na nią śmiertelne niebezpieczeństwo.

Abyss to interesująca gra łączaca elementy przygodówek point & click, puzzli oraz horroru. To ciekawe połącznie, zapewnia wciągająca rozgrywkę i dobry klimat. W grze nie utkniemy na przekombinowanych łamigłówlach i irracjonalnych sytuacjach. Całość jest spójna a decyzje i czynności są logiczne i przedstawione klarownie. Nic tak nie irytuje w tego typu grach, jak momenty, gdy nie wiemy, gdzie udać się dalej i krążymy bez końca po dostępnych lokacjach, niosąc w ekwipunku np. pędzel, dwa grzebienie i wykałaczkę. Ta gra jest pozbawiona zniechęcających niedopowiedzeń. Na drodze odkrywania kolejnych obszarów, natrafimy na rozmaite puzzle, o zróżnicowanym stopniu trudności. Rozwiązując napotykane zagadki, nie ma się poczucia, iż twórcy powtarzają się. Każda łamigłówka jest inna od poprzedniej. Pozytywny efekt dopełnia ładna grafika, klimatyczna muzyka i rzadko spotykana w tego typu grach, możliwość wybrania języka polskiego.

Dla łowców osiągnięć, gra również jest atrakcyjna. Zdobycie wszystkich 20 osiągnięc zajęło mi około 7h. Są wśród nich osiągnięcia odnoszące się do samej fabuły zdobywane automatycznie, jak i te, które wymagają od nas trochę więcej starań, ale większość z nich nie sprawia skrajnych trudności i ukończenie gry na 100% jest jak najbardziej możliwe.

16764131.review:
Game Information

Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden, is a HOPA game, that is developed and published by Artifex Mundi.

 HOPA - Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure.

Game Visuals

I want to mentioned that the visuals in the game is nicely done with a painted feel to them. The visuals can be adjusted in the game's option menu.

Game Audio

I want to mentioned that the audio in the game is well done even if it is simplistic and somewhat repetitive. The audio can be adjusted in the game's option menu as well.

Gameplay

There are three different difficulty game modes to choose from: Casual; Advanced and Expert.

The notebook keeps track of progression in the game. Such as story events and clues.

There is no padlock feature that is available to lock the inventory panel in place to make it stationary. The inventory panel does slides up whenever it is being moused over.

There is an interactive map in the game. It allows the player to fast travel between each location quickly. It also indicates that there are certain tasks that needs to be completed at certain locations within the game. The interactive map it automatically given at the start of the game.

The hidden object scenes consists of the following: Traditional word lists and Fragmented items. Some of these hidden object scenes may require little or no interactions. Most of the hidden objects scenes can be replayed in the game's extra feature section.

Domino is an optional mini-game that is only available during hidden object scenes.

The puzzles are fairly easy to solve without having the need to skip any of them.

There is a bonus chapter in the game. It can be access only after the main story is completed.

There are twenty different achievements that can be unlocked from playing the game. Each of these achievements does come with some requirements that needs to be completed before they can be unlocked.

Miscellaneous

There are extra features in the game: Bonus Chapter; Bonus Hidden Object Scenes; Soundtracks; Concept Art and Wallpapers. Most of these extra features can be access only after the entire game is completed.

There are six different trading cards to collect. You only get three of those trading cards from the game. There are several ways to get the rest of the trading cards: Purchased from the Steam's Community Market; Trade with friends; Booster Packs and its' Booster Pack Creator.

Final thoughts: I have found the game enjoyable to certain extent. The replay value for this game is low. I would recommend this game but not at the game's full price value.

Now depending on what you looking for this might be great or boring.

The pro's of this game:

+Love the artwork, really nicely done
+ Love the sounds / music 
+The puzzles aren't too hard and are fun to do
+It's a quick game and a good game to kill some boredom.
+Nice cut scenes in between the puzzles

The cons?

+Just like most point and click games it is a rather quick game to play (so don't expect a lot of hours of playtime )
+Travelling is gruesome, you have to click each room (lets say those are 5 steps) so you have to click 5 rooms before getting to a small task (for example finding an object) only to click the same steps back (you do have a map, but you cannot use it for shortcuts...)


All in all i liked most of the game (i played it 2,8h so finished it in one day) But now, after continuesly clicking through those rooms i have to say that my hand / wrist hurts So maybe for all you people out there; buy it on sale and don't play it straight through to avoid my problems xD

16202801.review:
I like these games for the puzzles (mini games), I would be happy with just them and no Hidden Objects and no story. Most of the time, the rest is fun too though. As is the case here.

I played this through a while ago, but not the bonus adventure yet, and wasn't much bothered by achievements. Now I replayed it for those two things. I enjoyed it the first time and had fun a 2nd (and will for a 3rd - for Domino) time. During the 2nd play-through I noticed that the hidden objects in the various scenes change in each play-through. Nice touch.

The hidden object games are just right for my taste (medium difficulty), the story is intriguing. The colourful places have something that really appeals to me.

The puzzles and the Domino as alternative to the hidden object games are fun to do.

I'd have liked an option to jump around on the map as is possible in some of the other games by Artifex Mundi.

It's a shame that the achievements for all hidden object/all Domino games can't be done via the extras, and needs a 2nd play through. On the other hand, as I said the story and the puzzles are fun, so I'll enjoy doing the replay twice even. 

There are few games where I don't turn the music off first thing, so I can't say anthing about that.

16183672.review:
Wie von Artifex Mundi gewohnt, weist auch dieses Wimmelbildspiel eine hohe Qualität auf. 
Anhand einer Story wird man durch verschiedene Schauplätze geführt, an denen man Aufgaben lösen muß um im Spiel voran zu kommen. Diese Aufgaben bestehen zumeist daraus, Objekte zu finden, mit denen man dann ein Minispiel starten kann, welches wiederum zum weiterkommen gelöst weden muß. Die zu suchenden Objekte sind dabei meist in Wimmelbildern versteckt.
Die Wimmelbilder und Minispiele sind dabei nicht besonders schwer zu lösen, machen aber dennoch Spaß. Zumal dadurch jeder die Chance bekommt, das Siel auch durchzuspielen. Schwerer ist es schon, den richtigen Ort zu finden, an dem man dann weiterkommt, oder ein neues Objekt findet. Viele Orte müssen mehrmals besucht werden, was einem manchmal hin und her laufen lässt.

Alles in allem kann ich dieses Spiel für Fans von Wimmelbildspielen nur klar empfehlen, wie übrigens alle Tilel von Artifex Mundi, die ich bisher gespielt habe.

Anmerkung zu den Errungenschaften: Wer alle Errungenschaften erspielen möchte, muss das Spiel zweimal spielen!
Für jedes Wimmelbild kann man alternativ auch ein Dominospiel spielen. Für beides gibt es aber eigene Errungenschaften. Macht nicht den Fehler und spielt mitten im Spiel ein Dominospiel anstelle des Wimmelbildes, oder merkt euch die Stelle genau, um beim zweiten durchspielen dann hier das Wimmelbild zu spielen. Sonst müsst ihr unter Umständen das Spiel ein drittes Mal starten um alle Errungenschaften zu erhalten. Den Fehler habe ich jedenfalls gemacht! ;-)

16151592.review:
Very enjoyable game. A bit darker than the usual HOG. The game has a lot of jumpscares.

You play a woman (whose name does not come up in the game iirc) trying to find her fiancee who went missing at sea while diving.  When following his footsteps she discovers a mysterious underwater city.

The art is beautiful and the music is good. The puzzles, I found, were either a bit too easy with a few exceptions with "wtf am I doing -spamclick until it works-". The game has 3 difficulty levels, the lowest difficulty shows actions availible on the ingame map and everything useful in the world sparkles. On the hardest no availables are shown and there is no sparkle. 

There is an achievement for not using hints in the HO scenes, but for progressing in the world the hint button is near spammable. As an option instead of the HO scenes this game has a domino game you can do. To get all the achievements in the game you have to go through the game twice; once playing hidden objects and once with dominos. My playtime is one game on hardest difficulty and HO scenes and once with skipping absolutely everything and speeding it.

Pretty much all cutscenes and dialogues are skippable. The map has no teleport option and is mostly useless on the harder modes as you're unlikely to be lost. The story is good,, though I wish you learned more about the world in the game. 

The game is the Collector's edition by default, so it has an extra chapter when you're done with the game as well as wallpapers, music etc. Small nuisance of how the opening cutscene to the game starts playing every time you open it, before the main menu, but as it's skippable it's not a big problem. I encountered no bugs and the game ran smoothly. As tends to be with this company the animation cutscenes is the least impressive part of the game, but still they're not terrible.

15724755.review:
Y quien a dicho que una aventura de buscar objetos no puede ser entretenida y de calidad, y encima con una buena historieta, Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden es todo eso y deja un buen sabor de boca, acostumbrado a jugar a este tipo de juegos no representa un reto excesivo pero cumple su cometido de entretenimiento como si de una historieta de libro o comic se tratara, con lo cual invita a llevarlo hasta el final.

El apartado grafico no es ninguna maravilla en tecnologia pero muestra gran colorido y detalle para su desarroyo, la banda sonora y efectos entran en un apartado acorde con el juego, el control y jugabilidad son totalmente correctos y simples, dispone de traduccion de texto en español, por lo cual entenderemos la historia del mismo.

Resumiendo: Estamos ante un buscador de objetos interesante y entretenido, con gancho por la historia que se nos ofrece, y aunque corto, no mas de 2 a 3 horas jugando tranquilamente, nos ofrece un contenido apropiado.

Valoracion final: 8/10 Recomendado.

15638857.review:
简单的说，点击式解谜游戏基本都是一个模型，寻找物品，解开谜题，玻璃用刀划，金属用酸溶，栅栏用气切，裂缝用锤砸，重要的物品都是在寻找11个无关物品之后才会给你，密码都是堂而皇之写在纸上而你需要做的不是去寻找密码而是去寻找输密码的方法，诸如此类的展开，玩的多了也就见怪不怪了。原则上，很难再这类游戏上找到很出彩的地方，一般比较破朔迷离的展开却总能迎来一个好莱坞式结局，最终的对手死于意外的概率超过90%。
《深渊：伊甸的幽灵》这部作品也不例外，游戏背景建立在一座海底城市：伊甸，曾经的繁华奇观吸引不少冒险家的驻足，而在一位冒险家神秘失踪之后，他的未婚妻毅然决然踏上了这条”寻夫之路“，不得不承认，游戏中部分场景的演出做的还是很有感觉的，但在几个装神弄鬼的桥段偶尔加速了玩家的心跳之后，他们很快发现这也不过就是找找找的变形：找开关，找钥匙，找阀门，找螺丝刀。而设计的小游戏也基本都是大家耳熟能详的，难见新意。游戏中隐藏物品寻找的替代游戏变成了类似于图案接力的”塔罗牌游戏“，比较容易上手，但很容易乏味，在打通一周目后，游戏会开启”特别故事“，讲述了在伊甸原住民的洛根的回忆，在短暂的探险中，玩家也能了解这位在正篇中给予主角很大帮助的人是何来历，这个部分需要点赞，人物塑造和场景安排也比正篇更加到位，至于其余的”壁纸下载“”小游戏重温“一类的设定，也只能说就是”看看而已“。
总的来说，这款游戏在同种类型里算是及格之作，但怎样做出新意，不能单单体现在画面和精心设计的成就系统上（顺带一提这款游戏想要打出全成就至少需要二周目）。剧情和谜题的设计才是重心，希望Artifex Mundi下一次有更好的表现。

Yet another great hidden object adventure game from Artifex Mundi.  While the story may not seem original, very Bioshock -esque, the story itself is good enough to keep you interested and also differs enough from Bioshock to keep it entertaining.  The graphics are beautiful with great animations and cut-scenes.  The puzzles can range from super simple to somewhat difficult.  The hidden object games aren't the most difficult that I've seen, but at least offer enough variety of objects to choose from that it's above par compared to other games of the genre.

Overall, this is one of the top of its kind, so definitely worth the play through.

15180067.review:
I really liked this hidden object game. I love that Artifex Mundi games have this deep twist of mystery in their games with some suprises as well as having music and story that draws you into the game. I would have to say, of their games I've played, this one might be one of the harder ones simply because things tend to blend in more with the background. I can see why that they have you "walk" between each room instead of skipping to the next area where you can perform an action (e.i. like in 9 Clues) but it gets a little annoying after a while. I'm also not a huge fan of the way the elevator works. Still, great game and I enjoyed. 

Pros:
-In deepth story and music
-Fairly good graphics (though its hidden object so i think graphics aren't such a big tado)
-Easy achievements
-Sequel potential

Cons:
-Movement between areas (it feels like you do way to much back tracking)
-The ending (no bueno, if it wasn't for the rat, i would have been very very very disappointed)

Toss Up:
-The blending of objects together (can be a little difficult)
-Knowledge required to complete game (you have to know some stuff about sea life otherwise the hidden object puzzles will confuse the crap out of you)

My recommendation 9.99/10

15158306.review:
무려 공식 한글화된 퍼즐 게임입니다.

같은 제작사의 작품인 9 Clues(이하 9개의 단서로 칭함.)를 먼저 해보고 작성하는 평가인만큼 '9개의 단서'와 비교를 해보겠습니다.

우선 '9개의 단서'에 비해 그래픽 퀄리티가 높아졌습니다.
이벤트 씬에서는 캐릭터들이 거의 다 3D로 움직이며, 중간중간에 놀래키기 위한 컷씬의 삽입도 눈에 띄입니다.

그리고 퍼즐 난이도가 좀 더 상승하였습니다.
자체적인 난이도 3단계 분류 시스템은 그대로이지만, 퍼즐 자체의 난이도가 전체적으로 향상된 것이 눈에 띄입니다.
하지만 숨은 그림 찾기 같은 경우에는 도미노 퍼즐 시스템을 도입하여 숨은 그림 찾기가 어려울 경우 대체용으로 도미노 퍼즐을 통해 진행할 수 있게 만들었습니다.

좀 더 어드벤처성이 돋보이도록 맵을 넓혀서 여기저기 열심히 돌아다녀야 됩니다.
그러나 맵 구조가 의외로 넓어서 진행을 위한 길 찾기가 조금 힘듭니다.

하지만 '9개의 단서'에 비해 퍼즐 난이도가 상승했어도 캐쥬얼 퍼즐 게임이라는 장르에 맞게 과도하게 복잡한 퍼즐은 넣지 않은 듯 합니다.

'9개의 단서'를 플레이해봤고 어드벤처성이 조금 아쉬웠거나 좀 더 어려운 퍼즐을 원하시는 분들께 추천.

15070677.review:
Let me start off this review by saying that I'm not too well-versed in hidden object games (yet). I played a free-to-play hidden object game years ago and remembered liking it well enough. I love finding things in games. Anything. Collectibles, secret areas, shinies, etc. Heck, I love searching for and finding things in real life, too. I'm a married woman and I still insist on my mother hiding my Easter basket every year. I'm not sure what's sadder; that my mother actually listens to me and hides my basket every year, or that she still gives me one at all.

Nonetheless, thanks to the Steam queue, I have been introduced to the genre yet again. I purchased a few on a whim one day, and Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden was the first I played. I was in a casual game type of mood after putting much thought and effort into a lengthy RPG, and this game was really enjoyable in that respect. 

The game opens up with your character's voice laying out the prologue to the story, and it made me giggle a bit because she sounded like a generic Microsoft computer voice at first. While the environments in this are beautiful and colorful, the entire game has a type of B-movie feel, with iffy voice actors, a "meh" story, and no sense of danger at all. The game definitely tries to throw some creepy moments at you, but never did I feel like my character was in danger or that a save would need to be reloaded. The game isn't scary at all for adults, but for young kids, it might be sufficiently creepy on rare occasions (and this game is definitely E-rated).

Abyss surprised me in that the game, while in the Hidden Object genre, was not overflowing with hidden object puzzles. I saw one review mention there were too many of them, but I wished for more. The game relies on an exceptionally well done and intelligently designed point and click adventure model for most of the gameplay, and the hidden object screens are mostly a distraction that include an object or two that you'll need to take from the hidden object puzzle and insert into the story gameplay. Sprinkled throughout the game there are also various mini-puzzles that go from sliding puzzles to jigsaw types to wire connecting puzzles. Not once did I feel like a puzzle was out of place or overly complicated. Even if (say, for kids) a puzzle is too confusing or hard, you can skip it. The game encourages you not to via some unlockable achievements, but it is an option. Unlike many point and click games, I never felt like combining objects to meet a goal was unnecessarily complicated. All of them made sense, so this game never frustrates.

Overall, while I did wish for more hidden object puzzles, I felt like Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden surprised me in its quality. It's relaxing and takes you on a nice little journey over about a four hour playthrough (I played on Expert despite being fairly new to the genre and never once was frustrated, so it's definitely casual!). While I would personally advise you to wait for a sale because I go by the $1.00 per hour of gameplay rule, I definitely recommend this game to anyone looking for a casual romp through some pretty environments. I'm giving this a 7/10. This is a great game for kids or for adults looking for a shorter game with little commitment. I was pleasantly surprised with this game, and I now consider myself a fan of the Hidden Object genre.

14845413.review: Was ist Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden? Ein Wimmelbild Spiel welches starke Einflüsse von H.P. Lovecraft hat. Warum starke Einflüsse? Es erinnert mich an die Geschicht “der Tempel” von ebend erwähnten Lovecraft, ausserdem ist die Geschichte auch stark mit dem Cthulhu-Myhtos verbunden. Die Spielmechanik ist halt wie in jedem dieser Spiele, finde A und bringe es zu B, was mit Minispielen und halt Wimmelbildern aufgelockert wird. Was man auf jedenfall noch erwähnen muss ist das es verschiedene Schwierigkeitsstufen gibt, ein Bonuslevel und man kann jedes Wimmelbild nochmal extra im Menü auswählen und erneut spielen. Mehr gibt es nicht zu sagen, die Geschichte ist in Ordnung, hat einige Schockmomente, welche bei mir aber nicht zündeten und die Grafik ist für so ein Spiel mehr als in Ordnung. In diesem Sinne Daumen auf jedenfall hoch.

14840470.review:
「ナイトメア・フロム・ザ・ディープ」と同系のアイテム探しアドベンチャー。本作はアニメーションがド派手になって画面全体がぐりぐり動く。親切なヘルプシステム・ロマンティックなＢＧＭ・平凡だがデザインの良いミニパズル・肩透かしのアイテム探しなどはシリーズ共通で、気軽に四、五時間つぶしたい人にはうってつけの内容になっている。
今回は本格ＳＦっぽい舞台設定や演出で格調高い雰囲気をまとっているのだが、アドベンチャー部分はカジュアルゲームそのもののチープな展開が続くため逆にコミカルに感じられてしまうのは欠点かも知れない。日本語ローカライズも丹念にされているのに一部に重症の誤訳があったりフォントの違和感が目立ったりと、何かとアンバランスな印象が強くて勿体ない気がした。
ま、肩の力を抜いて遊べば価格相応に楽しめるゲームかと。マップを見るのと見ないのとでは難易度に雲泥の差がつくので、サクッと一周回りたい人は操作可能地点の分かる「アドバンス」、じっくりアドベンチャーを楽しみたい人は「エキスパート」で始めることをオススメします。

14669154.review:
Esse jogo foi a minha grande fuga dos jogos mais aventureiros que dominam o mercado hoje em dia. Apesar de ser um jogo relativamente bem curto, te coloca para quebrar a cabeça e raciocinar bastante em cada cena que é passada. O jogo se passa no fundo do mar, aonde uma mulher, vai em busca do seu noivo (Robert) que saiu para dar uma "passeada" no fundo do mar e acabou não voltando, nesse passeio, ela acha uma um submarino naufragado, entra e assim é arrastada para literalmente o fundo do mar junto com ele, a partir dai, tudo começa.

O objetivo principal do jogo é achar Robert, mas com essa busca ela acaba descobrindo várias coisas, incluindo uma ameaça, criando assim objetivos distintos. O seu único comando é com o mouse, clicando nos cenários para achar itens e resolver os quebra cabeças do jogo para assim seguir adiante. Tenho uma certa facilidade com jogos puzzle e Hidden Object, mas tenho que assumir, tiveram momentos que eu não sabia para onde correr hahaha

Aconselho jogar em modo avançado, para que o jogo não fique tão fácil, afinal, no modo iniciante, ele basicamente entrega aonde você deve clicar para seguir em frente, tornando assim o jogo bem fraco. Não posso deixar de ressaltar, sou fraco para sustos e jogos de terror, então não me usem como parâmetro, mas conseguir saltar da cadeira umas três ou quatro vezes. Sem mais, o jogo ta valendo cada centavo gasto!

14643918.review:
这是通关的第11个steam游戏了。也是Artifex Mundi出品的指指点点的解谜游戏。还记得深海恶梦三部曲麽，这作里面有个医务室墙上一张图就是深海恶梦的一个场景，算是彩蛋吧。
看了下时间，这作是12年的，比上次吐槽的时间之谜2晚了一年，果然制作水平上去了，剧情啊谜题的设置比较合理，让人玩的顺畅了，不过这作在大地图上不能点击地点来移动，算是个缺憾，尤其是那个电梯。不过也是剧情需要，后期的话有的场景会被堵过不去，而且有的时候需要一步步走过去触发剧情。
游戏还是个英勇的女主角（貌似玩到现在都是女的主角），为了救男友，勇闯海底城。原来叫做“伊甸”的海底城，现在已经被恶魔占领了，然后女主一路闯关，最后重新设立法阵，封印恶魔，救出男友。 就不吐槽steam的介绍是救未婚妻了，整个剧情简洁流畅，谜题设置合理，道具也很直观，基本上遇到什么就能自己想到“啊，这个东西我能这样解”。最后，自带中文就是好。

14356587.review:
На первый взгляд - обычная бродилка с головоломками и поиском предметов. Но. 
Первое же, что очаровывает в Бездне - музыка. Мягкая, атмосферная, одновременно успокаивает и расслабляет, создает впечатление, что находишься реально на глубине. Далее идет вполне неплохая для игры такого жанра графика, цвета яркие, сочные, но глаз не режет. Мимика лиц подкачала, но это уже дело десятое. От легатов этих в первые моменты действительно шарахаешься, да и сюжет в принципе заставляет попотеть, пока разберешься, что к чему. 
Мини-игры порадовали разнообразием и, при этом, оказались не шибко сложными: действительно подумать пришлось разве что над сценой со свечами ближе к концу и камерой в бонусной игре. 
Из минусов можно назвать лифт. Пока доберешься, куда тебе надо - забудешь, за чем, собственно, туда пошел. 
9/10 ставлю смело и отношу к любимым играм.)

14348544.review:
"Abyss" hat eine schöne Grafik und eine angenehme Storyline, der man gut folgen kann.
Man kann zwischen drei Spielmodi wählen - leicht, mittel, schwer - und je nachdem, für welchen Schwierigkeitsgrad man sich entscheidet, ist das Spiel eben unterschiedlich schnell.

Ich selbst habe das Spiel auf "mittel" gespielt und auch wenn viele der Bereiche noch angezeigt wurden, mit denen man interagieren konnte, war es zeitweise eine Frickelarbeit, die richtigen Stellen zu finden, wo es nun weiter geht.
Im Vergleich zu anderen Wimmelbildspielen, liegt die Grafik bei Abyss bzw. bei allen Spielen des Herstellers im oberen Bereich, sowohl die Szenen, als auch die Filmsequenzen - alles wirkt stimmig, nichts ruckelt.

Das Einzige, was schade ist, ist die teilweise mangelhafte Übersetzung, bei der man teilweise um viele Ecken denken muss, oder sich einfach durch eine Wimmelbildszene klicken muss, weil der gesuchte Gegenstand falsch übersetzt wurde. Diesen Mangel machen aber die wunderschöne Grafik und das Sounddesign wieder wett.

Ich kann ideses Spiel leidenschaftlichen Wimmelbildspielern nur empfehlen.

14208045.review:
[h1]Добро пожаловать в [strike]Восторг[/strike] Эдем![/h1]

Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden - еще одна хорошая игра в жанре hidden object от Artifex Mundi. В этот раз мы отправляемся в  заброшенный город Эдем, находящийся глубоко под толщей океана. Играем мы, как всегда, девушкой, которой предстоит спасти своего жениха и жителей города, победив древнее зло, которое случайно было разбужено самими обитателями подводного рая. В целом могу сказать, что сюжет довольно неплох, хоть он почти полностью состоит из уже известных идей из других игр.

В геймплейном плане что-то описывать почти нет смысла - стандартный поиск предметов и головоломки, соотношение которых к друг другу подобрано весьма удачно, что позволяет игре не надоедать однообразными задачами. Графически игра выглядит хорошо (для игры своего жанра), однако анимация лиц персонажей подкачала, что, впрочем, не столь важно. Еще одним минусом игры можно считать отсутствие быстрого перехода по карте, который здесь очень бы пригодился из-за лифта, на котором приходится ездить очень часто и тратить на него много времени.

[i]В целом - годная игра для любителей жанра, а также для тех, кто ищет простую игру для отдыха и/или получения всех достижений. 6,5/10[/i]

Um problema do cara ter muitos jogos é que passo mais tempo escolhendo um jogo do que jogando eles então peguei o primeiro da lista e achei esse ótimo jogo, me fez lembrar dos meus tempos de PC da Positivo e que só jogava jogos de "Objeto Oculto" e posso dizer que foi uma ótima ideia jogá-lo.
        
[i]Obs: Se quiser ler o resumo da análise pule direto para "Considerações Finais".[/i]

[b]◄ Estória / Objetivo ►[/b]
	[quote=] Tome bastante fôlego e encontre sua noiva desaparecida no abismo negro do oceano. Descubra e investigue uma esquecida cidade submersa construída em um intrigante estilo art-déco. Esta antiga utopia esconde muitos segredos arrepiantes e forças sobrenaturais, cujos resquícios ainda se ocultam em cada canto. Enfrente o antigo mal que está se escondendo nas profundezas das câmaras da cidade do Éden. [/quote]
Com essa premissa, a estória de [i]Profundezas: Os Fantasmas do Eden[/i] é um tanto quanto clichê mas boa o suficiente para te manter interessado, algo que muitos Hiden Objects falham em proporcionar. Algo importante a se notar: Interface, legendas, textos (incluindo texturas) todos em PT-BR!

Para quem curte, as conquistas proporcionam ainda o fator replay. A estória principal e todos os puzzles giram em torno de 3 a 4 horas dependendo de como jogado, já com as conquistas esse tempo sobe para 6 ou 7 horas.

[b]◄ Jogabilidade / Controles ►[/b]
Junte os gêneros "Apontar e Clicar" e "Objeto Oculto" o jogo não apresenta muitas difículdades pois os puzzles são muito fáceis de resolver, algo que pode agradar tanto jogador mais familiarizado com o gênero quanto novatos.

O game consiste apenas em clicar em portas/passagens para se movimentar através dos cenários, interagir com objetos e resolver puzzles divesificados. Existem 3 tipos de puzzles:
[list]
 [*]Objetos Ocultos: Como o próprio nome diz, procurar em determinado cenário os objetos ocultos listados;
 [*]Dominó: Você pode optar de ao invés de resolver o desafio dos objetos ocultos, jogar um jogo de dominó;
 [*]Mini Games: em certos pontos do jogo você precisará resolver certos puzzles para prosseguir com a história;
[/list]
[b]◄ Gráficos / Visuais ►[/b]
É incrivel que jogos de produtoras indies [u]na maioria[/u] das vezes conseguem nos cativar com seus visuais e traços belíssimos, [i]Profundezas: Os Fantasmas do Eden[/i] teve um capricho incrível por parte da "Artifex Mundi sp. z o.o.".

A ambientação da cidade no fundo do mar é magnifica! Quem já jogou ou já viu imagens, é praticamente impossível não comparar determinados lugares com o famoso e glorioso [i]Bioshock[/i] (que ainda pretendo jogar), como por exemplo [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=361720668]essa screenshot[/url] tirada em um elevador logo no início do game. Inclusive veja outras análises, vão falar a mesma coisa.

Um problema que presenciei, algumas texturas que contém texto demoram para carregar de vez em quando do inglês para o português. 
Animações da boca dos personagens ao falar são extremamente bizarras, teria sido bem melhor deixar sem animação do que fazer o personagem ter uma animação robótica na boca.

[b]◄ Efeitos Sonoros / Soundtrack ►[/b]
Os efeitos sonoros foram bem implementados, você realmente se sente em uma instalação submarina e passa a sensação de um lugar misterioso e assustador.
Assim como os efeitos sonoros, trilha sonora é muito boa, se ajusta a atmosfera assustadora do lugar.

A dublagem não é lá grandes coisas, não passam a emoção que tem que passar em determinadas cenas.

[b]◄ Multiplayer Local / Multiplayer Online ►[/b]
O jogo não possui nenhum tipo de multiplayer, seja local ou online.

[b]◄ DLCs / Expansões ►[/b]
Já incluído na compra do game vem um conteúdo adicional que pode ser acessado através do menu "Extras", trata-se de uma história que ocorre bem antes dos acontecimentos da história principal onde é mostrado e falado mais sobre essa misteriosa Cidade.

[h1]Considerações Finais[/h1]
[b]Prós:[/b]
+ Enredo interesante;
+ Interface, legendas e textos em PT-BR;
+ Horas de gameplay até grande para o gênero;
+ Conquistas aumentam o fator replay;
+ Controles simples;
+ Diversidade de puzzles;
+ Visuais belíssimos;
+ Efeitos sonoros bem implementados;
+ Trilha sonora se ajusta a atmosfera assustadora;
+ Estória adicional já inclusa;

[b]Contras:[/b]
- Demora de renderização de algumas texturas;
- Animação da boca do personagem ao falar bizarras;
- Dublagem muito simples;

[b]Nota Final: 7.7/10[/b]

Experiência agradável, certamente voltarei a jogar jogos desse gênero, é uma boa dica para quem quer fugir dos gêneros mais comuns. Recomendo para quem gosta do gênero e principalmente para quem quer experimentar pela primeira vez.

Mas apesar da qualidade, não acho que o jogo vale o preço cheio de R$15,99. Recomendo pegar em alguma promoção de pelo menos 50%.

14070730.review: An enjoyable, if a bit monotonous game.  I suppose this is to be expected from this genre, which is a new one to me.  The story is adequately suspenseful, though predictable.  I found the wordplay involving the hidden object games amusing and often clever.  The one problem I have with the game, and this is near a deal breaker for me, to be the voice acting of the main character.  Her tone constantly seems overly cheerful or questioning, and the voice itself has almost no character or depth to it.  At one point, when she encounters a sea ghost, the last of whose kind imprisoned and then attempted to murder her, she exclaims, in a flirty quip, "What's your game?"  His game is to kill you!  Why aren't you scared?  This would only be a minor fault, where it not for the fact that this robo-woman is tasked with half of the dialogue in the game.  In the end, I was forced to add my own excitement to the character.  Picturing her as a lovesick psychopath, intent on gaining the pleasure of killing her beloved Robert for herself, she wanders an abandoned sea-station, laughing at the impotent attempts of sea-ghosts to scare her.  Psycho-Grade = B-

14058447.review:
He jugado a la mayoría de aventuras de Artifex Mundi con mi hija de 6 años y nunca me defraudan. Historias originales con grandes dosis de misterio y toques sobrenaturales, pero apto para públicos muy jóvenes. No hay nada de mal gusto que les pueda estropear la experiencia.

Los problemas que plantea la aventura se resuelven con la típica mecánica de usar los objetos que vas encontrando en las distintas pantallas. En el inventario nunca llega a haber muchos objetos a la vez, lo que simplifica mucho las soluciones. Tampoco es necesario combinar objetos entre sí para crear nuevas herramientas. No hay opciones de diálogo como en otro tipo de aventuras, pero sí muchos puzzles, y muy currados, tanto que los más pequeños no serán capaces de resolver la mayoría por sí solos. No pueden faltar tampoco los juegos de "Objetos Ocultos", un imprescindible de este tipo de aventuras sencillas, que aunque no plantean un gran reto, son muy atractivos para los niños.

Absolutamente todos los juegos de Artifex Mundi, a pesar de estar orientados a un público no muy exigente, rezuman buen gusto por todos lados, y este Abyss no es una excepción. El arte del juego es sobresaliente y cada estancia está llena de detalles. Los enigmas son sencillos pero no estúpidos, y todas las soluciones tienen mucho sentido, no habiendo nada absurdo o ilógico.

La duración del juego no suele ir más allá de las 5 ó 6 horas si juegas con niños. Si eres un jugador experimentado y te enfrentas solo a un juego de este tipo (no sé muy bien por qué querrías hacer tal cosa) seguramente no te lleve más de 3 ó 4 horas.

Lo recomiendo sin dudar, teniendo en cuenta a qué público está dirigido, y sobre todo al precio tan reducido que sueles encontrarlo en Steam.

13931776.review:
After my experience with Enigmatis 2 it was pretty obvious that it wasn't the last Artifex Mundi game I played, but since the first Enigmatis game wasn't released at that time yet, I got the game which seemed the most interesting instead and that was this one.
Judging by the voice actor we're controlling the same character who this time takes a dive into the sea to find her love who had gone missing, only to discover an...aaand that's where I stop, don't wanna spoil that one for you, but still to give a point to this review I think that the story is just as good as it was in Enigmatis 2 while the gameplay is almost completely the same with some very minor design differences.
It has the atmosphere, the challenge factor (which I found noticeably harder regarding the "100%ing" in terms of achievements which I gave up on this time xD) and some replay value as well, just like in the other game.

It's one of those cases when you have a well working recipe for a good experience and the only thing you have to do is to make very minor changes, just to give this other experience it's own identity, nothing else. 

In other words, play this one if you prefer underwater environments and abandoned places to chilling forests. I personally prefer Enigmatis 2 over this one so far, but ONLY because of the environments, nothing else. 
In terms of everything else, it's just as good as that game.

13920812.review:
Cons:

-Poor translation to English in places (notably for the names of certain items in hidden objects scenes)

-Standard nonsensical progression (ie there are thin vines blocking a puzzle which you can't pull off with your hands or cut with scissors or a knife; you have to wait until you have the hedge clippers)
-Standard hackneyed plot
-Puzzles are too easy
-Game has zero replay value, yet in order to get all achievements you must play it all the way through at least twice

Pros:
+The entire cast of characters is made up of what appear to be outdated animatronic puppets with terrifying faces and dead eyes to match their wooden voices. It's like playing through a ride at Universal Studios, about 20 years ago.
