13592183.review:
Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden ist ein Wimmelbildspiel, dass in einer Unterwasserwelt spielt. In rund 3 Stunden Spielzeit muss man seinen vermissten Freund suchen, retten und aus dem vermeindlichem Paradies flüchten. 
Es hat mir von der Atmosphäre und der Umgebung her sehr gut gefallen, es wirkt etwas ausgefallener, als andere Spiele von Artifex Mundi. Der Soundtrack fügte sich gut ein und untermalte das ganze.
Lediglich viele falsache Objektbezeichnungen haben mich in den Wahnsinn getrieben, hier hat die "Übersetzungsabteilung" sehr schlampig gearbeitet. Ich sllte einen "Baseballschläger" finden und das Objekt, was tatsächlich gesucht wurde war eine (lebendige) Fledermaus. Die Minispiele hingegen liefen wie geschmiert.
Die Steam-Erfolge kann man in 2 Durchgängen erledigen, wegen der Dominospiele-Erfolge. Dauert das Spiel beim ersten Mal 3 Stunden, so wird man beim 2ten Mal nur die Hälfte der Zeit benötigen.
Ingesamt kann ich Abyss empfehlen, das Spiel hat mir persönlich viel Freude bereitet.

Игра идеально подходит для любителей flash-квестов с посредственным сюжетом (без претензий на оригинальность) и поиском предметов среди хлама. Проходится за 2-3 часа расслабленной игры, что по сути плюс, поскольку затягивать подобную игру было бы попросту неприлично. Головоломки предельно простые — у среднестатистического игрока не должно возникнуть проблем с их решением. Стилистика довольно приятная, но с человеческой анатомией у художника(ов) явно проблемы, как и с лицевой анимацией.
Стажа в подобных играх у меня хрен целых, ноль десятых, поэтому сравнивать не с чем, но для первого опыта очень даже неплохой выбор.

P.S. В игре присутствует пара-тройка неожиданных хорор-моментов, так что особо впечатлительным стоит иметь в виду.

Моя субъективная оценка: 6/10.

13346420.review:
Is a man not entitled to the sweat of his brow? "No" says the hidden object section, "he has to find it in a big pile of crap along with an umbrella and three gears." "No" says the puzzle section, "he has to assemble a map or arrange sliding blocks the right way." I rejected those answers. Instead, I chose something different. I chose the impossible. I chose . . . the "casual" difficulty and abused the hint system.

This is a standard hidden object game with some point and click adventure game elements, puzzles and using objects on things, added in to keep things varied. Probably the most notable thing is that the plot and setting are copied from the original Bioshock.

The puzzles are bit simplistic and the hidden object sections aren't quite as cluttered as they could be, but the art is fantastic and difficulty isn't really the appeal of this kind of game anyway.

So this game likes its jumpscares so be warned.

As always hidden items games for me can be simple to super hard depending on the game.
For this one on the easiest setting the hints reset fast enough to not be frustrating and didn't reset when used for a "which way do I go" style hint.

This game suffers from the "item name/common convention/colour contrast" issue I've seen with afew of these. You're looking for a key? Well odds on its gonna be almost the same colour as its background. Looking for an umbrella? Better keep and eye out for images of one that blend into the background.

As to the voice-acting; Bland; End of story
Speaking of story its interesting and worth sitting through.

Would I recommend? Yes; At full price? Maybe not

Ein nettes Spiel für zwischendurch. Es ist in etwa vier Stunden durchgespielt und die Rätsel sind eher einfach gehalten. Diese sind jedoch abwechslungsreich gestaltet, von Suchbilder über Logik-Puzzle bis hin zu traditionellen Point and Click Aufgaben -in diesem Punkt also Daumen hoch.

Die Story wirkt hingegen recht gezwungen und vorhersehbar, allerdings ist es offensichtlich dass die Geschichte nicht das Hauptaugenmerk bei der Entwicklung war. Ich finde es jedoch super, dass man nach dem Durchspielen noch eine kurze Extrakampagne bekommt, in der die Vorgeschichte mehr beleuchtet wird.

Die Grafik (meist Standbilder) ist hübsch anzusehen und die Musik dezent gehalten.

Mein einziger und sehr klarer Kritikpunkt: Ein Übermaß an Jumpscares. Die wirken nicht nur billig und nervig, sondern sind in diesem Genre auch noch völlig deplaziert.

Insgesamt ein guter Zeitvertreib für einen Abend, aber mehr als 5€ solltet ihr dafür nicht ausgeben.

13078511.review:
Antes de jugar a Abyss, creía que los juegos de objetos ocultos no eran para mí. Vistos desde fuera me parecían aburridos, sin argumentos, lineales. Y seamos serios: "Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden" no va a ganar ningún premio por sus magníficos guiones o sus complejas animaciones. No harán una película ni venderán merchandising. 

Pero es un juego muy entretenido. 

Es un título genial para echar un rato delante del ordenador, olvidarte de todo y centrarte en salvar a tu marido Robert (que es un poco inútil). Personalmente me parece una aventura gráfica simplificada, donde tan sólo te mueves por unos cuantos escenarios y vas superando distintos puzzles. No hay mucha complejidad, pero si aún así te quedas atascado en algún momento puedes darle a ese bonito botón de «Saltar» y continuar jugando como si nada. El argumento y sus personajes, aunque no resultan excesivamente originales, cumplen con su cometido y consiguen meterte en la historia. El apartado gráfico cumple con creces en cuanto a diseño y dibujo; las animaciones son otro cantar (sobre todo las de los personajes cuando hablan, auch).

12994816.review:
[h1]Short version: 89%[/h1]
Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden offers everything one can want in a hidden object puzzle game: a good story, fluent game flow, interesting puzzles, nice graphic design. A definite grab if you like this genre.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
There are hidden object games that try to ascend the limits of their genre to stand out. Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden chose to be good in the known game elements instead.

Although the story is just a mishmash of Bioshock and Cthulhu, it is an almost perfect mixture. It is engaging, features genuinely good twists, and has a realistic, interesting main character. The only real downside is the voice acting, it is spectacularly bad even by hidden object standards.

The puzzles themselves are spread out evenly and offer a steady progression. They require a fair amount of backtracking, but the map design doesn’t make you feel like you are walking around endlessly. The hidden object scenes are drawn well, although they have a few problems, especially if the required item is in the water.

I also have to mention the bonus chapter: not only it gives you great insight of the main story, but it even puts one of the side characters in the limelight, adding even more depth to the game.

还有各种矛盾的地方，就是商店页面这里我显示的是拯救未婚妻，但事实上是个拯救未婚夫的故事。
……嘛，拯救“未婚妻”在某种意义上也是对的，因为我感觉女主就是担任责任重大的丈夫形象，男主角从头到尾都病怏怏的大叔受样应该没多少女性脑子坏掉去嫁给他的吧？相反男二号洛根的形象倒是塑造得不错，至少在附加关卡我看到了他对自己的妻子挺痴情的一面，就是建模毁气氛。

……好吧我对游戏的建模有着很大的怨念，封面上的恶魔使节看上去多么帅气啊但是一到游戏中下半身简直不忍直视（其实根本就是半身被截肢了为了掩饰所以下面都是薄薄的塑料破布吗），好不容易在这类游戏里看到三个萝莉但是建模完全就是伤害萝莉控的玻璃心而存在的。

最后为某个干尸路人点个赞，我不知道泡在海底这么久了为什么没有巨人观而是变成了干尸差不多的样子，那位群众演员好像出现过四次，第一次是潜水艇上扮演船长，第二次和第三次分别是在电梯开门的一瞬间倒下了还有就是在通往圣树之前玻璃门还未开启时飘在水中吓唬女主，第四次好像是在负一楼接待室那个玻璃窗上再次出现的，其实干尸先生就是女主的真爱吧?绝对是的，才不是制作组为了省经费才这样做的呢，其实我对圣树复制粘贴了两棵放到不同的地图这件事才没有心存什么怨念呢(´・ω・`)

12809081.review:
Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden

Uno de los mejores juegos de Artiflex Mundi, la historia es interesante, los graficos realmente son muy bueno, se nota que tienen mucho trabajo, los puzzles son muy entretenidos.
Una de los factores positivos de este juego es la posibilidad de hacer la parte de hidden objects de dos modos distintos, de la forma tradicional o mediante un juego de domino, con lo cual es imposible trabarse.
La unica contra es que como todos los juegos de este genero, tienen una historia divertida con mezcla de suspenso pero llegando al final es como que se le terminan las ideas a los desarrolladores y terminan muy rapido y sin explicacion de porque suceden ciertas cosas.
Algunos de los puzzles que hay en este juego tambien los podran encontrar en otros juegos de Artiflex Mundi en que el contexto es diferente y la ambientaciòn otra, los puzzles son los mismos.

De todas maneras es un indie del genero puzzles muy entretenido y si tienen la oportunidad de comprarlo en un bundle les anticipo que va a ser una buena compra.

Saludos.

12783848.review:
Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden is a Hidden Object Game. 

The adventure backdrop is fine, the areas are rendered with great details and the hidden object scenes are even in Expertmodus quite simple. Instead of Hidden-Object Riddles you might also opt to play a kind of Domino to solve the HOG. The riddles in the game are also quite simple and none of the riddles required a deeper explanation than a simple sentence. 

The story of the game is mysterious, and sinister. I like mysteries, and I love lovecraftian horror - but even with some hints in this direction the game has overdone it in a way that in the end all is only ridiculous.

This is no "Nancy Drew" game, that is for sure, and the riddles are much less challenging than any of the Nancy Drew game series. Still it is a decent HOG-Game, and sure something that fans of that genre can't wait to dig their teeth into.

Even though I am sceptical about this genre, it was a pleasing - even if at times insultingly ridiculous - game. Of course they are short casual games, but that is - what they were made for.

Graphics: 7/10 (Adventure style graphics with some artistic sights)
Sound: 8/10 (A fitting soundtrack to the game, that is fitting to the game)
Playability: 7/10 (It is fun to play it through once, and try out the two other modes of game - but once played through, they soon loose their ... color?)
Story: 6/10 (Ok Story, a bit far-fetched. But hey it's all a fantasy, isn't it?)
Value: 6/10 (The value of the game might lie between 4 and 8 bucks, so 6,49 isn't bad at all, if you can try to get it cheaper)

Overall: 6,8 (A mediocre game, which might please friends of the genre or people who love underwater adventures)

★★★★★ - Hodnocení v rámci žánru Hidden object

Kupoval jsem ve slevě za 2.59 euro a mohu opravdu jen doporučit.

Další skvělá hledačka od Artifex Mundi. Od tohoto týmu vývojářů už snad ani nelze očekávat nějaký slabší kousek. Grafika a celkové zpracování je excelentní, během hry jsem nenašel žádný bug a hrou jsem se vyloženě bavil.

Příběh je moc pěkný, odehrává se v zapomenutém podmořském městě Eden. Tvým úkolem je odhalit všechna tajemství, porazit zlo a z jeho spárů vyrvat svého milovaného přítele.

Hra je protkaná pěknými videosekvencemi, rozhovory, variabilním prostředím a v neposlední řadě také solidními puzzly. Dohrál jsem teď poprvé na nejnižší obtížnost bez použití HINTů za 5 a půl hodinky

12674425.review:
[i]Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden[/i] is only my second encounter with a so-called "Hidden Object Game". It's a prime example of the quality that Artifex Mundi delivers in this particular genre of games, which can best be defined as a point-and-click adventure light with as an extra ingredient the Hidden Object-screens. Artifex Mundi delivered a really interesting game with this one, which is like an overtly hommage to [i]Bioshock[/i]. The setting shows a lot of parallels to that of the famous and revolutionary shooter: just as in [i]Bioshock[/i], I found myself exploring an underwater city where an utopian society had crumbled into tyranny and civil war. Even the art déceau-style of the city is very similar in Abyss to that of Bioshock. It may be a bit too obvious for some, but it's so well done and the screens are so well-drawn and full of details, that for me it felt more a parallel reality, an alternative, to the world of Bioshock than like any sort of plagiate.

In all possible departments, [i]Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden[/i] truly shines. Artifex Mundi invests a lot in putting a convincing story into their Hidden Object-games, and they certainly managed to do so in this game. They also managed to integrate the several hidden object-screens and the mostly cleverly designed puzzles very convincingly into the story. The adventuring-part of the game plays very smoothly and intuitively, helped by the minimal inventory. As far as the musical score and sound-effects are concerned: they do their job in conveying the sometimes scary atmosphere in the game. It would be too much to call this a horror-game, but there are some very rare scaring moments.

Being a collector's edition, there are quite some neat additions included, such as an extra chapter to the story and some downloadable screens. All in all, this is a very recommendable game. Hidden Object Games-lovers will certainly know that they safely can expect a high level of excellence from this company, but I'd surely recommend it as well to those gamers who haven't yet played this genre before. They may not be difficult or competitve, but certainly entertaining and addictive!

Overall score: 7.5/10

12655136.review:
Another terrific casual adventure from Artifex Mundi!  This one mashes up a bit of the Mythos with a whole lotta Bioshock, for a story in which you head out to rescue your undersea-explorer husband who has gone missing.  You dive at his last known location and find first a broken-down lab, and then a stark, sprawling, deserted city on the sea bottom.  

The city is called Eden, not Rapture, but the principles are the same, and the explorations and puzzles that follow are tricky enough to be interesting and pliant enough to cave under pressure.  NOTE that the "Hint" button becomes a "Skip" button during puzzles, so if you are paying the wrong kind of attention, trying to figure out what the puzzle rules are can turn into a whoops-skip (this happened to me twice).

12587602.review:
Spielwertung: 8/10

Mit sehr viel Wohlwollen eine 8 und keine 7 oder 7.5. 
Das Spiel ist wirklich schön, sehr liebevoll gemacht und macht auch Spaß!

Die Wimmelbilderrätsel sind spannend, manchmal etwas zu leicht, manchmal etwas kniffliger.
Man kann aber immer auch alternativ Memory spielen, wo man immer gewinnt. 

Die Story ist das Herzstück und klasse erzählt. Die ein oder andere Wendung ist vielleicht etwas platt, aber in diesem Rahmen alles paletti. Man spielt hier ja nicht die Nacherzählung eines Literaturnobelpreisbuches. 
Natürlich sind die Anlehnungen überdeutlich, gerade zu Anfang fühlt es sich an wie bei Bioshock, etwas Jules Verne und Atlantis inklusive. Aber was solls, man erfindet die Welt nicht mehr neu. Im Gegenteil. Gerade diese Momente sorgen für ein gewisses Prickeln. 
Die Graphik ist sehr überzeugend. Das Comichafte hat manchmal kleinere Aussetzer, man merkt, dass die Engine nicht in der A-Klasse mitspielt, aber die flüssigen Übergänge zu den Ingame-Cinematics sind super, die Ladezeiten für Levelübergänge fast nicht spürbar. 
Der Sound ist atmosphärisch, aber auch etwas klassisch. 
Die Steuerung ist ein Selbstläufer. 

Mit einer Länge von ca. 5 Stunden imo auch keine Enttäuschung an dieser Front. Wenn man es einmal gespielt hat, gibt es aber keinen wirklichen Grund, es noch mal zu spielen. Tut man es doch und merkt sich ein bisschen was, kann man es auch in 1.5 Stunden schaffen. Außerdem positiv der "Mini-DLC", der zumindest bei mir gratis unter Extras lag und noch mal für ein paar Minuten bis einer Stunde Abwechslung bot. 

Kommen wir zum Negativen:

Neben kleineren "Bugs" bzw. Ungereimtheiten, die alles in allem nicht stören, ist das Erfolgssystem eine Katastrophe. Zwar beeinträchtigt das nicht das Spielerlebnis als solches, gehört aber nunmal zum Spiel und zu Steam dazu. Warum, frage ich, gibt es 3 Schwierigkeitsgrade, von denen 90% der Spieler beim ersten Mal vermutlich den Mittleren nehmen, nur damit man das Spiel für 2 Erfolge noch 1x auf "Expert" durchspielen muss? Klar, kann man vorher sehen, aber ich mag diese Streckung der Spielzeit nicht. Vor allem, wenn nach 2x durchspielen auf Expert immer noch kein Erfolg da ist (siehe Forum, das Problem haben einige, aber Lösungen sind purer Zufall...). Auch so 2 "Hammererfolge": 1x Alle Wimmelbilder ohne Hilfe lösen, 1x alle Dominos. Tja, habe ich gemacht... keine Erfolge. Warum man diese Lücken nicht einfach im "Extra" Fach, wo man beides extra spielen kann, ohne Hauptgame, ist mir schleierhaft. 

Erfolge gehören nun mal dazu! Wer sie einführt, sollte sie auch anständig programmieren bzw. auf allzu große Gemeinheiten verzichten. Zumindest wenn es sich um ein Spiel handelt, dass in die Kategorie B oder C vom Preisniveau fällt und auch von der Spielzeit und -motivation in diese Kategorien gehört. Niemand wird dieses Spiel wohl mehr als 1x, vielleicht 2x durchspielen wollen, Vergleiche zu Langzeitzeitfressern und stetig erweiterten Spielen wie WoW oder CSGO verbieten sich daher, wo natürlich auch komplexe, zeitfressende bzw. fast unmögliche Erfolge ihren Platz haben müssen. 

Abseits dieses Ärgernisses: Eine volle Spielempfehlung! Man wird hier 2-3 schöne Spieleabende verbringen, wenn man sich nur einen Hauch für einen Mix aus Geschichtenerzählen, Adventure und Rätsel interessiert.

12583852.review: 2D背景+3D动态效果所呈现出来的画面非常漂亮，但是过场动画分辨率略显粗糙。去寻找在瀚海深渊里失踪的未婚妻吧。*探索一个被遗忘的建筑风格神秘的水下城市遗迹。*这个曾经的乌托邦里仍然潜伏着很多让人毛骨悚然的秘密和超自然的力量

12559842.review:
If you have played an artifex mundi game before, by this point you know what to expect; a beautiful blend of puzzle solving, object hunting and hidden object finding (or domino playing instead), all bundled in a gripping adventure, full of mysteries, that slowly unfolds before your very eyes. If not, grab your mouse and relax: the ride is thrilling and wonderful.
There is usually some curse or supernatural element involved in their games and Abyss (the hidden object game version of Bioshock) is no exception. As you travel in a ruined underground city that aspired to be a beacon of freedom and enlightenment, you face and have to overcome mysterious adversaries that look like demon-eyed Wraiths in order to free your beloved (and also save the few free people that were left, some tired bloke pushing his forties and about three kids).
It turns out that the cause for all this is Cthulhu, or rather a strange statue found deep inside a mining shaft at the bottom of the ocean, depicting a humanoid body with the head of an octopus. Sounds familiar? I hope so.
At this point I am sure that Artifex Mundi have a Cthulhu and Cthulhu-mythos obsession and I love them for it (Cthulhu statue in Abyss, fishmen in nightmares from the deep: siren's call and the Necronomicon in 9 clues:the secret of serpent creek).
The avatars in this installment have really stepped up their game, the faces are life-like which is mostly due to the vivacity of the eyes and that is a delight to watch - although I also enjoy their painterly ones in other games.
The shock value of corpses showing up everywhere is also thrilling and adds to the unsettling atmosphere of Abyss, making it just the right amount of creepy.

TL;DR: *Cthulhu possesses underwater city people and tries to expand his empire.
*Explosions!
*Giant octopi!
*Dinosaur skeletons!
*Corpses! Corpses everywhere!
*Save Cthulh---eeerrr the world!

12546703.review: Totally not Rapture in a hidden object game, sounds bad but it isn't.

12517088.review: Davvero poco interessante, trama scopiazzata da più film e giochi differenti, animazioni pessime e cosa ben più importante, una traduzione italiana davvero schifosa, con nomi di oggetti tradotti male e in modo del tutto arbitrario, si vede lontano un miglio che per gli oggetti sono stati utilizzati traduttori automatici...il che rende certe sezioni di "trova l'oggetto" praticamente impossibili da fare senza aiuti.

12513861.review:
Fun story, pretty visuals. Made me think of Bioshock for a bit. That said, I liked this less than 9clues for 3 reasons:
1) lot's of backtracking
2) no fast travel like in 9clues
3) maybe a bit too many 'hidden object puzzles'

12499280.review:
Ein wirklich empfehlenswertes Spiel, das mit toller Atmosphäre, liebevoll gestalteter Spielumgebung und packender Story überzeugt. Einmal angefangen, konnte ich garnicht mehr aufhören - hab es schließlich in 3 Stunden durchgespielt. Die Spielzeit ist also etwas mager, dafür gibts aber die Möglichkeit, das Spiel noch einmal auf höheren Schwierigkeitsgraden zu spielen.
Fesslend ist das Spiel vermutlich nicht nur wegen der Story selbst, sondern auch, weil man ständig Erfolgserlebnisse hat: Die Rätsel sind recht einfach, teilweise vielleicht sogar etwas zu einfach. Doch wie gesagt -  das bringt schöne Erfolgerlebnisse und viel Spaß für den Spieler und verhindert jegliche Anflüge von Frustration.

Ich habe das Spiel kostenlos über Indiegala bekommen, finde aber, dass es sein Geld wert ist.

12497769.review:
Enjoyable Hidden Object game with a 'BioShock'esque story.

The minigames/puzzles vary in difficulty but most of them are pretty simple, the Hidden Objects parts are of average difficulty. There's a lot of backtracking in this game and sadly there is no fast-travel like in some other HO games. Overall it is a bit too easy to complete but still a fun game nonetheless.

Encountered no bugs or broken achievements.
A second run-through is required to get 100%.
One of which needs to be in expert mode.

7/10

12491863.review: Bei dem Spiel handelt es sich um eine Mischung aus einem Point&Click-Adventure mit Puzzlen und Wimmelbildrätseln. Man durchsieht hier nicht nach und nach jeden Raum, sondern findet immer mal wieder einen Gegenstand den man irgendwo anders benutzen muss, wenn man der Story folgt weiß man eigentlich wo man hin muss. Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist völlig in Ordnung und das Spiel ist schön anzuschauen, die musikalische Untermalung ist auch gut. Beim Setting haben sich die Entwickler wohl etwas bei Bioshock abgeguckt - Denn auch hier gibt es eine Unterwasserstadt, hier heißt sie jedoch Eden. Alles in Allem ein klasse Spiel sowohl für Genre-Neulinge als auch -Veteranen.

12486317.review: If you happen to be a fan of hidden object games or point and click adventures then this is the game for you.  A very creative game that does a very good job with it's limited budget.

12485606.review: Wife likes these kind of games and liked this title.

12474510.review:
Wenn man weiß, worauf man sich einlässt - ein Wimmelbildspiel mit einigen (einfachen) Adventure-Einlagen - dann bekommt man ein qualitätsvolles und atmosphärisches Spiel geliefert. Die "Bioshock-esque" Geschichte ist gut erzählt und enthält einige kleine Schock- und Twistmomente, der Soundtrack und die Untermalung hat mir sehr gut gefallen. Insgesamt kann das Game einen für 3 Stunden beschäftigen, will man alle Achievements haben, muss man es zumindest 2-3 mal durchspielen (was schlecht gelöst ist, da der Wiederspielwert gering ist). Grafik und Szenerien sind hochwertig gehalten, die Wimmelbilder gut präsentiert (wenn auch seltene Übersetzungsfehler auftauchen), die kleinen Logik/Mechanikrätsel relativ einfach gehalten.
[b]Fazit:[/b] Ein gutes Spiel für Zwischendurch mit netter Geschichte und guter Unterhaltung; besser als manch andere Hidden Object Games.

12454717.review:
Really, pretty good for a "casual" game. You can turn the difficulty to "Expert" at the start and make it more like a real adventure game which probably helped.

Anyways, the game's got some good atmosphere (courtesy of Bioshock) and a decent plot. The hidden-object games can get a bit tiresome, but hey, there's dominoes too if you don't care for them. Achievement set is a bit annoying in that it requires you to play through the entire game at least twice but ehh, it's quick enough the second time through anyways. I wouldn't call it a top-tier adventure game or anything but it's certainly worth checking out if you can get it cheap.

12451431.review:
我在玩這家公司出品的這系列遊戲之前，
沒有想過自己會喜歡這樣子互動電子小說，

當老是吃大魚大肉的"重量級"遊戲之後，回歸清粥小菜確實挺不錯的。

12449909.review: 这类找物品解密游戏一直都很喜欢。说实话觉得本作的找物品有点难。。。。在水下各种鱼各种遮挡各种隐藏。。。。而且动画很多，不是很喜欢，觉得有点太频繁了。不过简体中文做的挺好的啊，还有卡片，还是很推荐的。

12443536.review: 有简中好评，不过有些翻译不正确。而且商店介绍是寻找未婚妻，其实是寻找未婚夫的。全成就挺简单的。总的来说，一款中规中矩的解谜游戏。

12438459.review:
Abyss: The wraiths of Eden is a point & click game. The story is quite intriguing and the game features unique puzzles besides the usual "find these items" puzzle. The game takes a while to beat (2-3h if it's your first time and you're not using any walkthroughs) so it'll keep you busy for a while. I recommend this if you love casual point & click games.

Besides the main story, it also has a bonus story which will take you roughly 1h to beat. If you're any achievement hunter like me, the achievements aren't hard to get but it'll require you to beat the game a second time (which is quite boring).

12437735.review: A really solid Hidden Object game with a good story, those of you who have played Bioshock will certainly see some similarities with the design of Eden though the plot itself sets itself apart. I wasn't really a fan of the domino mini game but it was useful when I absolutely could not find an object and did not want to use a hint. It's not quite as refined as the companies later games and you will find some recycled puzzles if you have played their later stuff but I still really reccoment this to HOG fans.

12430772.review: Slow and boring after while... Only a good game when u r bored in a cold winter night otherwise theres some free version of this online as flash games.

12428805.review: You know how in [i]Bioshock[/i] you can find ammo, health and money if you keep your eyes peeled?  Ever wonder what it would be like if the entire game was nothing but that?  Artifex Mundi sets out to answer this question in [i]Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden[/i].

12427545.review: Hra mě velmi příjemně překvapila. Ač je to adventura pro příležitostné hráče, tak obtížností mi přišla tak akorát. Na rozdíl od klasických adventur není třeba mít neustále po ruce návod. Na všechno se dá přijít i bez použití integrované nápovědy. Příběh je zajímavý a musím přiznat, že jsem se několikrát během hraní pěkně lekla. Pro získání všech achievementů je třeba dohrát hru dvakrát.

12396104.review:
Very good game but so short =)

12374798.review: Игра-квест на логику, не страшная (хоть и присутсвует немного хорроров).

12367634.review: I don't usually like puzzle games like this, but this stood out like a pearl in the mud to me. If you're interested in the genre in the slightest, this is a great game to start with. It has a decent story, engaging environment and great puzzling.

12366291.review: I love point-and-click games that also have puzzles and hidden objects BUT they must have a wonderful story to go along with it. This story was interesting from start to finish and moved smoothly through the game-play. The puzzles weren't too difficult and the hidden object portion was sometimes a little too easy (if you prefer there is a dominoes game you can play instead) but overall it was a fun 5 hours. I definitely recommend if you like this genre. OH and while it's definitely not scary it was pretty spooky to play with headphones on in the dark. Very fun for the month of October! I'm looking forward to playing it again.

12360915.review:
Die dunklen Tiefen des Meeres beherbergen mehr Geheimnisse, als die simpel klingende Rettungsmission verraten mag. Eine Stadt, seltsame Gestalten und eine große Menge an Aufgaben, die uns unserem Ziel näher bringen, aber auch tiefer in die Geschehnisse dieser Metropole eintauschen lassen. 

Das schaurige Bild einer zerstörten Zivilisation kommt dabei gut rüber, denn die Hintergründe sind schön präsentiert. Getrübt wird das Gesamtbild jedoch von einer mittelmäßigen Synchronisation und schlechten Animationen von Bewegungen und Gesichtern. 

Die Wimmelbilder, sowie Kombinationsaufgaben erfordern zumeist ein gutes Auge und logisches Denken - die Rätsel sind zumeist logisch und von der Schwierigkeits her auf einem niedrigen Niveau angesiedelt. Das Hilfesystem wird tatsächlich nur ganz selten bis gar nicht gebraucht, funktioniert dafür aber tadellos!

Freunde von Gelegenheitsspielen, sollten sich [i]Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden[/i] genauer anschauen. Die 4 Stunden Spielzeit sind zwar relativ kurz, bieten aber gute Unterhaltung für ein bis zwei Abende.

12321332.review:
Gameplay was fun, nice mash-up of puzzlles along with the reason I got the game - hidden objects. I played throughit on casual in one sitting and plan on playing the higher diffculties soon.

Main downside (but not a deal-breaker) was the really bad voice acting and story in general. It's not really a drawback because you're not expecting a triple A story from a game like this but some moments just made me go "...what?"

12317090.review:
A nice and entertaining adventure although a bit on the easy side. My main problem  was that I didn't know all the names of all the objects in the "hidden objects" minigames.. 

That being said, the story was interesting, the puzzles doable and the graphics more than good enough for the game. An entertaining 3 evenings adventure game.

12302515.review: I love the visuals in this game and the storyline flowed very well. That is hard to achieve in point and click game. I regret playing the game on easy because I finished it within three short hours. To enjoy the game and not fly through it you need to play it on a higher level. Really fun game and would recommend.

12279623.review: I like point-and-click adventure games, especially when Artifex-Mundi makes them. Abyss is no exception to the great games they have made so far. The puzzles, story and artwork was great.

12253284.review:
For a casual, primarily hidden object game, it's not bad.  The story's interesting, the graphics are nice, and the sound effects are decent.  I beat it in a little over 3 hours.  In addition to hidden object style minigames, there are also various renditions of other minigames like pattern matching, hit every location only once to move your token, as well as some very basic point and click adventure mechanics.

On the flipside, the music is repetitive, it has no replay value once you've beaten it unless you HAVE to get every achievement, facial animations are weird, character animations are just ok (for about 8 years ago), and the dialogue and voice acting sounds like it was written and performed by a high school amateur troop.  But hey, it's a small game publisher, possibly with English not being the language the game was originally written for.  It's a decent game, but I wouldn't buy it unless it was on sale considering the lack of replayability and the short playtime.

12253058.review: Pretty good hidden object game. Just lacks fast travel. Good art, good puzzles. 4 h play time.

12237577.review:
Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden ist ein wunderschön gestaltetes Adventure-Wimmelbild, dass einen in eine Unterwasserstadt (Rapture aus Bioshock nicht unähnlich) entführt.
Die verwendeten Rätsel sind, wenn man schon einige solcher Spiele gespielt hat, nicht gerade neu, aber auf jeden Fall schön umgesetzt. Als Ausweichmöglichkeit zu den Wimmelbildszenen bekommt man hier eine Art Domino-Spiel angeboten, bei dem durch korrektes Anlegen der Dominosteine bestimmte Felder belegen muss um die Szene abzuschließen.
Wer also keine Wimmelbilder mag kommt an ihnen herum.
Die allgemeine "Logik" des Spiels bleibt sich, im Gegensatz zu anderen Spielen, größtenteils treu und wird nicht abstrus.

Freunden solcher Spiele kann ich Abyss nur herzlichst empfehlen. Artifex hat hier saubere Arbeit geleistet!

12224488.review: Jogo de clicar com problemas e quebra-cabeças para resolver. Joguei no fácil para entender o jogo e depois no difícil para pegar todas as conquistas, deu uma dorzinha de cabeça mas consegui.

12209898.review:
Un bon jeu de point & clic, si vous hésitez, n'ayez crainte, il est agréable à faire.
Vous pouvez désactiver les aide pour un maximum de difficultée et augmenter la durée de vie du jeu.

12174302.review: As fun and interesting as their other games - though the French translation is buggy, which makes looking for some objects quite a challenge - like looking for a baseball bat, and discovering you should actually look for the animal bat...

12166274.review:
Abyss: The wraiths of Eden Completed primary story line but still have a few achievements.

This is the second one of these that I have played now and like the first one I really enjoyed it. If you would like to see my other review, please follow this link: http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561197979162305/recommended/284870/

The overall meta of this game is similar to the last one. It's a casual point and click adventure with find the items in a big pile mini games. Compared to the last one I felt that this one was slightly harder which is good but I still managed to finish it in less than 4 hours. I would again recommend that you play it on Expert mode because it is a very easy game really.
This one I enjoyed quite a bit more than the last one. I have no idea if this one is chronologically older than the first but the production values seem to be much higher this time. The characters have some wonderful 3d modeling and very nice animations.

I wonder if the main character is supposed to be the same? She uses the same voice actress at the very least. I wonder if it is, I think that if it is she must be one of the most unlucky person in the world! Unlike having the ungodly detective powers of the first, there is a bit more MacGyvering this time around. This feels a little more realistic and I do appreciate it. 
The game had a couple of jump scares that got me so well done with that :) The last one didn't manage at all. 

If I had to complain I would say the music got really repetative really quickly and I ended up turning it off after an hour or so and listened to my own MP3s.  Your milage may vary on that.

I don't want to say too much as a point and click game is all about the story and its hard to talk about it without spoiling anything however its a nice story line and your character is fun to play as. It's nice to see more games where you get to play as a female that isn't there purely for fan service.

I feel that this game deserves a very well earned 7/10!

It's short and sweet but its very high quality and if you like point and click games I think you should consider buying it!

Is this an overall better product than Serpent Creek? Maybe....I am not suffering as much from the dysphoria today so maybe that put me in an overall better mood. Frankley I am happy to have played and experienced them both however :)

This is a nice little studio, I think I would consider myself a fan and I will hopefully get a chance to play some of their other games soon!

12105051.review:
Tipico juego de Misterio donde hay que encontrar objetyos y resolver acertijos. La historia sin ser muy reluciente cumple con el cometido, en cuanto a la musica esta de una buena ambientación, especialmente la escena extra.

Lo que realmente me sorpendio fue encontrar una amplia colección de fondos de pantalla asi como la musica, que es usada en el juego lista para ser guardada para ser disfrutada fuera del juego, hojala que mas juegos tuvieran estas opciones.

Recomendado con un descuento de al menos 33%.

12061963.review: Este juego es una pequeña aventura que mezcla puzles, objetos ocultos y point&click. El arte esta conseguido, aunque las animaciones son mejorables, y lo mejor es que consigue no hacerse aburrido. La historia es entretenida, aunque algo predecible, parece una version endulzada de Bioshock. En general lo recomiendo para pasar un rato agradable, y destacar la completa traduccion al castellano, que aunque no alcanza al doblaje, si incluso a los textos en juego y  no unicamente a simples subtitulos.

12025190.review:
I was really impressed by Artifex Mundi's Alex Hunter: Lord of the Mind,  but I didn't enjoy this one anywhere near as much. It does have some nice scenery when walking around the underwater city, but once it switches to a Hidden Object Scene, it's noticeably uglier. The HO scenes are also fewer and farther between, and they're over with too quickly. The bonus chapter is ridiculously short. Yeah, I know, it's just a bonus, but Alex Hunter's bonus was almost as long as the main game. The plus side is that there are a lot of puzzles to solve, but many of them are similar to puzzles in other games of these types (and in at least one case, exactly identical). The human models are some of the most terrifying I've ever seen, and there's a weird, inconsistent blend of hand-drawn art with CG art. Also, constantly having to go up and down an elevator with no way to skip the animation was really annoying.

Unlike Alex Hunter, it has achievements and trading cards, so if that's important to you, it's the only thing it really has over it. So, no, I can't give a strong recommendation unless you just can't get enough of these types of games.
Rating: 2/5

12012388.review: Artifex Mundi probably make the best hidden object / point and click adventure games, no exception here. To say the setting is a rip-off of Bioshock is putting it lightly, and the storyline lacks any of the nuance of that game, but it's suitably atmospheric and the gameplay uses it well. As for the rest, it's a point and click adventure game interspersed with set-piece puzzles and hidden object challenges. The artwork is very good, the character animation is pretty dated, the puzzles are mostly fairly undemanding although there's the occasional headscratcher (usually due to missing a vital clue or scene somewhere, so you'll need to search the entire map at times), good music and - as usual with these games - truly dire voice acting. Still, there's something about these games that makes them a nice, relaxing diversion.

11983589.review:
Cant really recommend this to anyone as its not that much fun and its not very interesting. 

The puzzles are very easy to solve, finding items takes less then 2 minutes you can click really fast and still get them all without even looking.

Grapics arnt great the games stable didnt have one crash.

I cant say i liked this game too much although it wasnt that bad but its not worth spending money on.

11967311.review: These kind of puzzles are so worth of your time.

11952325.review:
So... it's a bit hard for me to actually choose between recommending this game or not... but I will do my best to talk about it and explain my reasons.

This game, if you couldn't tell already, is a point and click game, and if you like that kind of game you might enjoy this somewhat.

There are a few different ways of interacting with things, perhaps this isn't the best way to explain it but you'll get what I mean in a minute, some of these make sense, other don't make any.

When you can examine something a magnifying glass icon will appear, this usually zooms in on the object or makes your character "say" something (which appears written on top of the screen). Hand icon you usually take or grab items (when "grabbing" you don't take them but can use them to interact with other items). These are the interactions that make sense, and little minigames where you solve puzzles to open a secret lock or something, that makes sense too.

What doesn't make sense is that throughout the game you will encounter a type of minigame that's just stupid in context, it's one of those "screens full of garbage" and that you have to find a certain amount of items. This doesn't make sense for a lot of reasons: Firstly, the purpose of finding all of those items is so that you get ONE of those items to use, for example, if you need a handle, you can find the handle in the minigame but you still have to find a whale, a box of crayons, a fedora, 3 lollypops, etc. JUST to get to keep the handle.

Also worse than that, some items aren't even there, you have to "make" them. An example of this is in a part where you need a "Dotted tie"... however the only tie there is 1 solid color... what do you have to do? Grab a crayon and click the tie, you will then draw dots on the tie and THEN you can get it. I know it's supposed to entertain the player a bit but it's just stupid! Specially most of those item combinations! Oh yeah, and many of the items you need aren't even items, they can be drawings or something like that... so yeah...

However, if you don't want to do that minigame and look for everything you can do a domino game instead, there will be a big grid with some 2x2 trees scattered about, when you get a domino piece to touch one of them it's the same as finding an item in the other minigame. You get 3 dominoes and you can flip them however you like. There is also a handle on the left that changes the 3 dominoes you have in case you can't use them or want something different.
Any combination of finding objects or playing the dominoes is fine, nothing changes really.

You cannot combine items in your inventory also, so don't worry about that.

My biggest issue with this game however is that it is very very linear, and if that wasn't enough, you even have a map that always tells you where you should go next, sure, if you have a good memory you don't even need that map, but it still looks a bit too much hand-holding (although you only open the map if and when you want it).

Another thing that makes the game much worse is the voice acting, SERIOUSLY! Specially the protagonist, she looks like she has no emotion, a monster can appear right in front of her face and she's all like "Oh, what is this?" like she doesn't even care.

On the aesthetic side, the game is actually quite well drawn and animated, there's a thing here or there but in general the looks of everything really fit well with each other and are gorgeous... HOWEVER! This is not the case for when someone talks to you!

Even though the characters look very well made (could be better in some cases but still), when they start talking it's just horrible and makes you want to look the other way, the ONLY thing that moves is the mouth, they don't even blink unless it's part of a cinematic speech, just the mouth moves and on top of that the mouth only has like 4 different poses, each stays there for almost a second and looks REALLY unnatural, it would look a lot better if they didn't move the mouth at all.


But all in all, it's a decent game if you're not looking for a hardcore point and click and just want to finish one, it doesn't take too long to finish and it's almost impossible to get stuff (even if you never use the "skip" or "hint" buttons).


So play this game if:
- You just want to casually play a point and click game;
- Want to look at some pretty sceneries;
- Do random stuff that make no sense whatsoever in context.

Do NOT play this game if:
- You want a good story with awesome voice acting;
- You want a challenging point and click where you have to figure out what to do by yourself;
- Want a deep and engaging story;
- Want to see realistic facial expressions.


So that about wraps my review, from 0 to 10 I think I enjoyed this game about 5... wasn't that good but wasn't that bad either, just enough to keep me going, but just because I wanted to try it out... took me about 2:30 hours to beat this game.


Oh, and the ending was the most stupid thing ever xD

11946121.review:
This is my second hidden object game I played by this developer, the first being [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/MaraKalat/recommended/259740]Nightmares from the Deep: The Cursed Heart[/url], and this one is pretty comparable.

This means that, if you haven't played that many hidden object games, this is a great introduction to the genre.
The player is tasked with helping a diver explore an under water city in search of her husband who's gone missing in these waters. Things quickly become tricky as the city appears to be deserted save for a ghost (or group of ghosts) as well as a pretty creepy little girl.
On the actual game side of it you have point & click adventure game style playing, where you navigate a series of screens and gather objects to manipulate the environment (open doors, fix machinery, feed squirrels, etc.) which in some way helps you along.
Gathering some (but not all) of these objects requires a mini-game. This mini-game is either the standard hidden object gameplay or a simple but entertaining enough domino-stone based puzzle. The awesome part, as with Nightmares from the Deep, is that the choice which mini-game to play is completely left to the player and can be switched at [i]any[/i] time.

The elephant in the room, something the other reviews undoubtedly also go into, is that this isn't the first game set in a weird, creepy under water city that has fallen into disarray where creepy girls walk around. The (excellent) game Bioshock had a very similar setting, and it's very unlikely that the developers of [i]Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden[/i] didn't at least take some inspiration from Bioshock. I personally didn't mind, but it might irk you if you're a fan of Bioshock I guess.

All in all this is a solid hidden object game. Don't expect anything ground breaking, but if you are looking for a little casual adventure this is a solid choice.

11863904.review: Хороший квест. Девушка исследователь ищет парня аквалангиста в подводном городе населённом мистическими существами и обычными людьми. Что понравилось - все действия логичны, можно пройти без подсказок, есть несколько уровней сложности, на эксперте нужные области не будут подсвечиваться, но всё равно остаётся возможность воспользоваться советом (даёт подсказку или решение в трудный момент игры). В игре всего одна фоновая мелодия, но она не навязчивая, если долго играть она звучит в голове. Озвучкой похоже занимались два человека - девушка которая озвучивает героиню и всех детей, и пожилой джентльмен это создает диссонанс, когда видишь молодого или средних лет мужчину, а слышишь старый голос. Анимация в игре хорошая за исключением “говорящих голов” у персонажей только губы шевелятся, но я думаю это из-за малого бюджета игры, помимо этого имеются неплохие ролики, заставки дополняющие игру и повышающие атмосферность. Игра пытается нас пугать получается не очень, но это вносит разнообразие. В локациях где нужно найти определённые предметы есть выбор переключиться на игру домино, здесь важно помнить что лучше придерживаться чего-то одного, либо предметы либо домино, это поможет в получении достижений, также здесь лучше не пользоваться советом-подсказкой. Ещё один момент связанный с достижением, пройдя на уровне эксперт всю игру я не получил соответствующее достижение, оказалось что для этого нужно пройти ещё и бонус на уровне эксперт. Бонусный уровень это приквел про одного из персонажей основной игры и его возлюбленную, он чуть сложнее чем основная игра. Рекомендую всем кому нравятся игры в жанре квест (Adventure).

11854435.review:
Sorry, but no. There are some significant caveats, but on the whole, it's still a bit more "no" than "yes". 

The game is standard fare HOG/adventure, which, true, aren't that much represented on Steam (currently), but the simple truth is - I've seen some much better. 

Everything just smells of laziness. Lazy graphic, lazy animations, lazy story, which, without even batting an eyelash is heavily ripping of Bioshock, lazy puzzle design, lazy minigames. It's not that it is bad, it's just not good enough. It's not that it's full of glitches, or has technical problems, it's just - lazy. 

Story is Bioshock with a cthulhu twist (and without *that one* twist). As said, many of 'shock's tropes are present. I'd say uncomfortably many - underwater grand city, but which has gone wrong, but whose magnificent glass domes still function, are full of air and warmth and haven't somehow collapsed, even though there are explosions, earthquakes, etc. in the game; then we have jump scare shocks; ominous monsters; dirtiness superimposed with splendor of buildings and blue ocean "skies"; there are even small girls with pigtails in skirts.

Though voice acting is competent enough for an indie game, again it's nothing special and there are HOG games with better ones (though at least here we are spared cheesy live action acting of such games as Mystery Case Files franchise). 

The game makes it's worst crimes with the inconsequential puzzles. E.g. you have a sturdy stick, rope and thread and needle in inventory and you need to get something out of a grate. There are several possible logical ways of going around doing it, but the game doesn't acknowledge any of them except the default one (say in my non spoilery example - bend needle on some pipe, combine with thread, but not rope, and fish the thing out of grate. Stick could have been used as a lever, or rope could have been tied to grate, but this gets ignored). Other thing - badly implemented HOG scenes. In one location you need something to cut the rope, and in the HOG scene you find two knives and one hack saw. But in the end you get from it something completely unrelated, some specific key, and you have to go and search for default knife in some other location. Objects in HOG scenes get ignored. 

Maybe few (well... more than 5, I'm old) years ago this kind of sloppy design would be awesome, or tolerated, but I think the genre has gone a ways and there are already many better games. Drawn series as well as various bigfishgames or ERS games have done it far more coherent. So no. I'd recommend to wait for them on Steam, not to get bad-ish first impressions of perfectly viable genre of games. 

As for the good things - scenes are painted nicely and even if heavily "borrowed", the atmosphere is very nice and can be properly chilly. Though constant jump scares quickly wear thin. This is no Amnesia - the jump scares come by the book and on the clock without much inspiration. Some mini games are fun and interesting and interaction in HOG scenes can be varied and satisfying. There are 3 levels of difficulty, though for me, playing it on normal, the game was much too easy. 

So there. I can't end this review without repeating myself over and over again. Not all components are bad, but there are many bland ones which make the Abyss not seasoned enough. If you want to try HOG games, you could, and you could be perfectly satisfied if you don't expect the next Monkey island, but bare in mind there are even better entries in the genre.

11758193.review:
I would highly recommend this game to fans of both hidden object games and traditional point-and-click adventures.

The story is engaging, the plot is coherent, and the horror atmosphere is fully immersive.  

The hidden object puzzles are straightforward and clearly labeled, with absolutely none of the "entire object is hidden except for a pixel" or "all of the objects blur together" problems that plague other HOGs.  There is a hint system, although you most likely won't need it, and you can always choose to substitute a game of dominos if you get stuck.  They also use common English/British synonyms for all of the item names (which may sound like a minor point, but is a big deal for those of us who have played other HOGs where a "fishnet" could be labeled as a "landing," or where items are randomly in a foreign language for no reason).

As for the mini-games, they are intuitive and fairly easy, and never feel tedious or like filler.  Instead, you feel a sense of accomplishment, as each mini-game serves to advance the plot in some way.

Additionally, the point-and-click puzzles are logical.  It was always pretty obvious what an item was going to be used for, so there was never any sense of frustration.  If for some reason you aren't sure of where to go next, though, your map (on the easier difficulties) will show you where you can perform actions.  Experienced gamers will not find this game challenging, even on the highest difficulty rating, but it is worth playing through anyway just to experience the setting and the craftsmanship of the gameplay.  I played through multiple times in one day so I could get all of the achievements, and it never got old.  

The voice acting is top-notch, the music provides just the right amount of creepiness or action, the backgrounds are beautiful, and even the CG people aren't horrible to look at.

The game is fairly short, less than 3 hours, but there is an optional bonus mission that adds depth and backstory to the characters.  Also, while there is a fair amount of backtracking, they make it feel fresh by having many areas change visually upon revisiting them.

All in all, I would give this game a 9.5/10, and feel it is worth the full $7.99.  It is far superior to any other HOG I have played.

11670958.review:
This game by Artifex Mundi is one of the most astounding Point-and-click games I have ever played.

Firstly, the graphics. The amount of detail and color gives the underwater environment, as well as the ruined city, a mixture of wonder, destitution and haunting, telling the tale of a once wonderful city reduced to ruins. While it may remind you of Bioshock, the game's enviroment is still totally unique in my opinion.

As for the gameplay, the Hidden Object gameplay never gets boring. It has two kinds of objects: one where you click on the correct one, and poof! Item found, while the second one has you find an item to open/reveal another before it is considered found, and done. This added a little bit of challenge and variety to the otherwise simple Hidden Object Scene. 

Tired of Hidden Objects? Switch it to Dominoes, where you will have to place the tile to reach the seashells to complete the game. Pretty simple, except that you must align the tiles correctly to move forward. 

Also other than those two above are the puzzles. While most are actually a piece of cake, some are really challenging. The puzzle design, as all I can say, well made.

The story, although it overall looked simple, doesn't mean it can't hook you up to this game. Though low-quality cutscenes sucked some beauty away from the story, it can still be interesting due to the mystery surrounding the sunken city. Voice acting is also top notch, as you can feel whatever they said, they really mean it. That is a redemption for the low-quality cutscenes at least.

Overall, I love this game. Though the characters aren't really memorable, the game's environment and gameplay makes this game unqiue compared to other Point-and-click games. The Collector's Edition also added other goodies (such as musics, and wallpapers) as well as an extra mission to understand how the city came to be.

For the price tag of $7.99, it was totally worth it.

11412477.review:
ポイント＆クリックの隠しオブジェクト系アドベンチャー。
深海に消えた婚約者ロバートを探すために海中都市エデンに降り立ったあなたは、エデンの亡霊と対峙することになります。

バンドルに含まれていたので気軽にプレイしてみましたが、良くも悪くもC級（Casual or Cheap?）といった印象です。

まずタイトルからして誤訳なところに一抹の不安が…。オブジェクト名も「スイレン（Water Lily）」が「ユリ」だったり、「時計の針（Hand）」をそのまま「手」と訳してあったり。
ちなみに壁などの文字も翻訳されてはいるものの、標準フォントなので雰囲気は台無しです。（もっともローカライズに伴うフォント関連は高コストなので、カジュアルゲームにそこまで求めてはいけないのですが）

グラフィックは美麗で、海中都市の探索やオブジェクト探しは非常に楽しめました。
ただシーンによってはキャラクターが3Dモデルになることがあり、会話シーンでのアップは正視に耐えない不気味さがあります。
感動の再会のはずが…ろ、ロバート、不気味の谷に陥ってる～！

ストーリーはお粗末、とはいえ本作に関しては物語よりもオブジェクト探しがメインの楽しみ方だと思うので減点にはならないかと。

おすすめしない最大の理由は、操作感が劣悪なこと。ポイント＆クリックはマウスポインタの感度が命ともいうべきで、本作のもっさりした挙動はストレスでしかありません。デベロッパは多数のポイント＆クリックを発表しているようですが、ほかの作品をプレイしたいと思わせるような内容ではないでしょう。

11099559.review:
Ein schönes Wimmelbildspiel.

Auf der Suche nach ihrem Mann muss die Protagonisten viele unterschiedliche Rätzel lösen.

Positiv:

- Die Story wird nett erzählt und animiert zum Weiterspielen
- Preis/Leistung ist vollkommen akzeptabel
- Die Grafik ist ok
- Kleinere "Gruselelemente" sind eingebaut-echt nett gemacht
- Die Rätzel sind nicht zu schwer, aber auch nicht zu simpel. Man hat hier also einen guten Mittelweg gefunden
- Bei Problemen kann man sich Tipps geben lassen
- Die Möglichkeit einige Gegenstände durch ein Minispiel, im Spiel zu bekommen, lockert das Ganze auf

Negativ:

- Wer grafische Höchstleisutngen von diesem Spiel erwartet, wird enttäuscht
- Wer ein sehr langes Spiel erwartet wird ebenfalls enttäuscht (wobei ich die 4,5 Std. Spielzeit vollkommen angemessen finde)
- Richtig knifflige Rätzel gibt es in diesem Spiel nicht unbedingt, wer also gerne viel und lange herumtütftel, für den ist dieses Spiel ebenfalls nichts
- Ich fand die letzte und entscheidende Konfrontation mit unseren Wiedersachern ein wenig zu abrupt beendet... hier hätte man vlt ein wenig mehr Story einbringen können, um das Final epischer zu gestalten

Fazit:

Mir hat das Spielen von Abyss viel Spaß bereitet und irgendwann werde ich es nochmal spielen, da die Geschichte nett erzählt wird und man auch für zwischendrin einige kleine Rätzelchen so lösen kann. Wer also gerne Wimmelbildspiele spielt, der macht bei diesem Titel nichts falsch.

11075801.review:
After the atrocity that was Empress of the Deep, I wasn't particularly excited to take on another Bioshock "inspired" hidden object game (or HOG for short). Nevertheless I descended into Abyss and its city of Eden, cautious but hopeful that it wouldn't be the stodgy adventure I half expected it to be. Color me surprised then when I became completely swept up in the remarkably high production values, enjoyably casual puzzles, and varied mini-games peppered throughout (heck, there's even some squirrel love). Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden isn't only exceptional for its genre, but a polished and entertaining game in its own right. It's elements may be something less than inspired, but Artifex Mundi mixes them together into far more than the sum of its parts, and certainly one of the best HOGs I've yet to find.

The obvious influence of Bioshock on Abyss can be seen everywhere, from the narrative of a lone traveler entering an underwater city intended as a bastion of all of humanity's greatest minds and creations, to the neon art deco environments, and the persistent theme of a city that failed under its own ambition. Abyss doesn't pretend to be more than it is though, and actually uses its limited resources to rework the plot of the game it so heavily borrows from into something more manageable, forgoing the heavy questions of morality for a more simplistic ghost story that while nothing remarkable is enough to hold the game together. The iffy voice acting and horrendous facial animation is another matter, but thankfully you are subjugated to these often enough to make you turn the game off in horror.

I call Abyss a HOG, but often it falls far more along the lines of a basic point and click adventure game. You explore locations, picking up objects along the way to help you solve puzzles, with just the occasional mini-game popping up often enough to remind you that you are still playing a HOG (if only in some respects). Personally I enjoy this combination quite a bit more than straight up Highlights, and found the simplicity of the puzzles oddly satisfying. It doesn't require much thought and there's always a hint button if you should get stuck, but it also doesn't treat you like a complete imbecile, requiring just enough from the player to keep from feeling like an interactive slideshow.

If you have been turned off from HOGs in the past from their lackluster presentations, mind numbing stories, or over reliance on the sole act of finding hidden objects, I'd suggest you take a look at Abyss before writing the genre off entirely. Its visuals are top notch, the gameplay at just the right level of casual friendliness without becoming tediously easy, and the whole experience feels like its operating a far higher budget with a better development team than I've come to expect from this sort of game. Let's just say I'm impressed, Artifex Mundi; here's hoping this is a sign of the quality we can expect going forward from one of my favorite gaming guilty pleasures.

10895463.review:
Abyss:Wraiths of Eden was the first Artifex Mundi game I have played, and it stands out in a genre that can be swamped in games that feel nearly indistinguishable from one another. 

The casual puzzle genre has always fallen into three categories for me. 
A) Pure hidden object, nearly each scene is just finding objects in a jumbled mess, very little straying from the base.
B) Puzzle point-and-click, where you have a lovely balance of varying types of puzzles, story, and hidden objects (generally 1st person)
C) Adventure point-and-click where you have a character who physically moves around scenes, like "The Longest Journey" (generally 3rd person)

Abyss would fall into the "B" Category on this one, and it was an absolute delight. It was pretty well voice acted, the difficulty wasn't too great, even on expert, but not a walk in the park either. The Dominos minigame was a neat and fun addition in lieu of doing the hidden object puzzles, the story was interesting although unfortunately left us wanting more, and the game itself flowed well and was very nice to look at. 

I only have two complaints really about Abyss. First, the lack of backstory on the cool Rapture-like place called Eden that is used as the backdrop for the game. Second, that I tried to start the game on expert so I'd only have to play through once. Why complain? Well, I managed to get myself stuck a couple times, and after exhausting all possible options, I went to the internet. 

Every single time it was because I missed clicking on something I had already interacted with that was now useable a second time. Now that it was able to be interact with them again, they would give me an item I could then use to progress. Mostly my own fault, but I felt this was counterintuitive, as I had already eliminated these objects from use. 

I enjoyed it enough that I played the bonus (check it out from the extras menu for a little more story) AND I'm going back through again on easy so I can get the Dominos achievement :) Highly recommend if you are a fan of class-B point-and-click games. From this experience, I will definitely buy all Artifex Mundi games going forward. They have a different feel from any other point-and-clicks. They stand out as higher quality, and more fun to play. A+

10373640.review:
Point-and-click Bioshock. What could be better?

As of writing this, I've played the game for about 90 minutes, all in one sitting. I am really enjoying the story, and the characters  seem to be very interesting. It's your basic point-and-click adventure game, but it has some shocks, and the overall atmosphere is pretty creepy. The game isn't bogged down too much in the minigames (other than maybe the hidden picture puzzles) and there is at least a variety to experience, it even has dominos!

I would have to say my favorite thing about the game is at the very least, a reasonable expectation of replayability. There are three difficulty settings, which, if I read correctly, have slightly different stories, and there's even an achievement for completing the hardest difficulty. What I consider to be the biggest flaw is how well it sits in the uncanny valley. When you watch a person talk, you'll know what I mean.

Overall, though, it's a pretty good, creepy horror-ish point-and-click adventure game that I think is worth your time. $8 doesn't seem like a high price for the game, and I suspect I'll be getting another 2+ hours of entertainment from it, so it's worth the money to me.

Cheesy story, amazingly detailed graphics and soothing music. Throw in dominoes or find the object in the picture, and point and click riddles, and a really good gaming flow throught-out the entire thing. It even have some cheap jump scares here and there

I got hooked and finished the game in one sitting, about three hours long. You could get a lot more by playing on expert, and not using hints.

Surprisingly, i look forward for other titles from these guys. It is the first time that i play this type of games, and it was really entertaining.

7/10

10315819.review:
Hatte eigentlich keinerlei Interesse das zu zocken, aber nachdem ich mal kurz reingeguckt habe, bin ich nicht mehr von losgekommen. Worum geht es?  
Es ist eine Mischung aus Point&Click Adventure mit Puzzlen, Gegenstandssuche und Wimmelbild-Elementen. Es erzeugt ein unglaublich guten Fluss. Ein Wimmelbild lösen, den neuen Gegenstand im Vorraum nutzen. Zum alten Raum zurück, ein Puzzle dort gelöst und wieder ein neuen Gegenstand bekommen, den man sicher bald wieder braucht. 
Die Rätsel und Puzzle sind logisch, reizvoll und befriedigend, wenn auch recht leicht (Tipp-Funktionen gibt es auch noch). Die Grafik ist für einen kleinen Titel absolut solide (könnte etwas schärfer sein) und die Musik untermalt die Stimmung sehr gut (wenn auch recht wenig Stücke). Das Setting ist unverkennbar von Bioshock abgeguckt, nur statt Rapture heißt die Unterwasserstadt Eden. Die Story um die scheinbar verweiste Stadt hält das ca. 3 Stunden große Spiel  gut beisammen.  
Insgesamt ein Spiel, bei dem man ganz gemütlich abschalten kann.

10315189.review: 首先简中好评。中规中矩的解谜游戏，玩久了容易烦，剧情一般。

10311068.review:
Suların derinlilklerinde geçen bir hikayeye sahip Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden. Beni en çok çeken kısımlarından biride buydu diyebilirim. Sulak yerde büyümenin getirisi olsa gerek, su gördüğümde merakıma yenik düşüyorum. Neyse lafı gevelemenin alemi yok, oyundan bahsedelim.

Su altında keşif ve araştırma yapan bir çiftin gözünden yaşıyoruz olayları. Eşimiz Robert karanlık güçler olarak düşündüğümüz ancak baştan bilemediğimiz bir şekilde kayboluyor. Biz ise onu önemseyen hayat arkadaşı olarak  tabiri caizse canımızı dişimize takıp, korkmadan, yılmadan, araştırıp keşfederek, bulmacaları çözerek, tıkalı yolları açarak ona ulaşmaya çalışıyoruz. Aramalarımız sırasında bir çok gizeme tanıklık edip bir çok ilginç durumla karşılaşıyoruz. Hikaye içeriğinde sadece Eşimiz ve biz yokuz, diğer karakterleride unutmamak gerek. Bize yardımcı olan ve bize umut bağlamış insanların hikayesine de tanıklık ediyoruz.

Bulmaca oyunlarını seviyorsanız oynamanız gereken bir oyun. Hikayesi, ambiansı, sesleri, bulmacaları gayet iyi bir oyun. Sıkıcı bir uzunlukta değil. 3 Saat gibi bir sürede bitirebilirsiniz. Fiyatı markette 8$  civarında. Bu parayı vermek istemiyorsanız indirim zamanlarını bekleyebilirsiniz. Ya da oyun pakedi yapan Bundle sitelerinden denk gelirse kaçırmayın derim.

Serinin farklı oyunları da var. Gerçi seri demek yanlış olabilir, Nightmare from the Deep serisi haricinde bir ikileme yapım şuana kadar gelmedi, biz kısaca aynı yapımıcının farklı hikayelerde geçen bulmaca oyunları var diyelim. Bu oyunu beğenirseniz onlara da bir göz atmanınızı öneririm.

Kısaca özet geçmeye çalıştım, umarım satın almayı düşünen arkadaşlar için yardımcı olur.
İyi oyunlar ;)

「BioShock」に影響を受けたであろう、廃墟となった海底都市を舞台にしたポイント＆クリックの

10148810.review: If you enjoy hidden object games (which I will refer to as HOG from here on out) you could do much worse than this fun little adventure/HOG hybrid with an obvious Bioshock influence.  Now you may raise your eyebrows when I mention "Bioshock" and "HOG" in the same sentence but this game takes place in an underwater city meant to be a self sufficient utopia. Yeah, the devs had Rapture in mind when they made this but that's not a bad thing as I enjoy that early century art deco look. The story was okay. The voice acting was not. Gameplay was your typical mini-games with hidden object goodness, none of which was too difficult which I liked. The one thing I didn't like was that there is a ton of back tracking. Get this object from here, take it over there and use it on this thing only to go back to where you got it from. Blah. Thankfully there aren't TOO many areas so you won't forget what was where. You can finish the main game and the bonus story in about 4 hours so th length is just right. Oh, and if you don't want to play the hidden object part there's an alternate mah-jong game which is also fun and a nice change. Overall I give this game an 8/10. I got this game in a bundle so watch for those in the future. Otherwise a $3 is a reasonable price to pay.

10116515.review: This game is cathered to a specific grouip of fan base. Those who love point and click adventure games should pick this up. The music is excellent, the story line is great and the puzzles challengeling. A good value for money!

10037701.review: Dagli stessi creatori di Clockwork Tales, un'altra splendida avventura punta&clicca che, anche se breve (circa 6 ore), riesce ad incantare con ambienti estremamente dettagliati ed una coinvolgente storia (anche se non molto originale). Le tipologie di enigmi presenti nei loro giochi ormai si assomigliano un pò tutte ma regalano comunque qualche ora piacevole, sempre interessanti i retroscena disponibili dopo aver completato la storia principale.

10023844.review:
Hidden object games are somewhat of a guilty pleasure for me.  I am quite fascinated with them, but generally balk at the idea of ever spending money on them (and there's admittedly no logic to this stance - it's just how it is).  So it was that Abyss (and its predecessor, Nightmares from the Deep) were picked up in bundles along with other games I actually wanted.  But hey, here was my first chance to play a commercial HOG as opposed to all the free ones I've tried on the web and they're actually pretty good.  I played Nightmares first and you can read my review of it here:  http://steamcommunity.com//id/dunetiger/recommended/259740/

So we come to Abyss: the Wraiths of Eden, a casual hidden-object/adventure game unashamedly inspired by and liberally borrowed from Bioshock.  At first, I dismissed the comparisons and thought they were simply tongue-in-cheek comments, but the truth is there is no denying Bioshock's influence on this game.  The story is this: your husband (you play a lady once again) has gone missing on a diving expedition and you're trying to track him down.  You end up in a strange submerged city called Eden (-not- Rapture), solving puzzles to defeat the forces of evil.  Pretty standard stuff.

Compared with Nightmares from the Deep, you now have high-res (720) cutscenes so no more fuzzies when they come up, but character models continue to be creepy and not purposely so.  Like Bioshock, there are little girls running around although they're not zombie creatures being followed by big dudes in diving suits, so at least the comparisons can end there, but I bring them up because they are REALLY weird looking.  I know it's not easy to model faces, but man....

Anyways, the format of the game is pretty much exactly like Nightmares from the Deep, but with a few minor differences.  Like its predecessor, Abyss is filled not just with HOG scenes (I think there's 16 of them to do in total), but also various find-object, use-object puzzles and a few brain teasers, but nothing really difficult.  On expert mode, nothing is pointed out to you and some areas will become pixel hunts; however, if you are playing with children, you might want to lower the difficulty where the game will be a little more forgiving with keeping the pace going.  Where Nightmares had the alternative of mahjong tile matching instead of playing the HOG, Abyss offers as its alternative a weird, but enjoyable domino-style game where you need to lay down dominoes in order to cover icons on a grid.  You're not REALLY playing dominoes, so it's more of a picture-matching exercise than anything else... just like "mahjong".

Other than that, the puzzles here are a little more clever than in Nightmares, and the only word of warning is there are some 'frightening' images that may not be appropriate for younger children.  Although I preferred the theme and story of Nightmares, Abyss is a fine casual game and can be enjoyed by anyone.

The only thing I really disliked in this game was the friggin elevator.

9840999.review:
I've played maybe 20-30 hidden object games to date (probably more), and I'd have to say Abyss is indeed one of the better ones out there, but has some flaws that really stuck with me as I played.

First of all, the game is beautiful.  Although the detailed artwork is clearly inspired by the Bioshock series (and a lot of story elements), it looks great with a colorful palette and some imaginative locations.  There are a lot of areas to explore, as well. The music is very nice and does a good job of setting the mood, but can get a bit repetitive after awhile.  

For the game play, this is your standard IHOG/HOPA, basically adventure game lite with Hidden Object Scenes sprinkled in.  As an adventure gamer myself, I always play on Expert to give me a bit of challenge and lengthen my game experience, but I found the game to be on the easy side overall.  Not a horrible thing if you're looking for a relaxing evening, but I prefer my IHOGs to last longer than 4 hours on the hardest difficulty. Even the puzzles were fairly easy taking me only a few minutes to figure most out, and many needing only a few moves to complete.  The most challenging part for me was going back and finding older Hidden Object Scenes that have reactivated; they don't sparkle in Expert, so it's basically a game of "let's click on everything" in the hopes the scene is indeed active again.  I know this is pretty standard for Expert mode in most HOGs, but honestly, it's just an exercise in frustration, not added challenge.  If the devs are reading this, putting in an option for sparkles on reactivated HOS's would be a much welcome addition in future games.

The Hidden Object Scenes themselves are well done, nicely drawn items without too much clutter, and have a nice range of difficulty, but none of the items were what I would consider unfairly hidden.  And although I really enjoy HOS's, I know not everyone is a fan, so the option to play Dominos instead is a nice touch.   The Dominos mini-game itself is fun, relaxing and mildly stimulating,  

While the story took a lot of elements from Bioshock, it didn't resonate with me as much as some of Artifex Mundi's other games.  I know HOG's aren't exactly a great source of deep, thought-provoking storytelling, but I felt like Abyss was flirting with some really interesting concepts, but those ideas kept getting derailed and neutered.

I think my biggest issue came down to the voice acting, though.  Maybe I'm being a little more critical than I should be having come off of a couple of games that had absolutely amazing voice actors, but here...it's just awful.  I wanted so badly to turn off the voices as every time any of the characters uttered something I couldn't help but cringe. If there is anything I would like to see in future HOGs it would be a toggle for the voices.  Sometimes just reading and letting my mind fill in the blanks is better than being stuck with voices that are pulling me out of the experience.

That said, I did enjoy the game quite a bit and can see myself playing it again in the future.  I certainly look forward to some of Artifex Mundi's other games making their way to Steam.

9837662.review: jogo muito bom, vale a pena

9814964.review:
Been a hardcore adventure gamer since the days of text-based glory in the 80s. Never thought I'd care about these hidden object games, to be honest the vast majority of them are tragically primitive. These Artifex Mundi games are not, they're in a class of their own.

There's a lot of classic adventure elements in them, you find items, figure out how to combine said items to achieve the result you're after and thusly advance the storyline. Every now and then you're confronted with a hidden object scene, a fact that makes my eyes water and kills my inner child bit by bit. In a stroke of pure brilliance they've added an option to play an alternative game and that way bypass the hidden object scene entirely. What you're left with is an adventure game and occasional boardgame challenges, fantastic. 

Rather uniquely they also tend to feature strong female protagonists that aren't constantly trying to assert the fact that they're female and strong, they just are. This is something that you'd be hard pressed to find in any other genre.

Finally, it works flawlessly in linux. As have all Artifex Mundi games I've tried so far.

9741466.review:
「乱雑な部屋の中から使うんだか使わないんだか
よくわからないアイテムを探すゲーム」は
正直、体験版でお腹いっぱいになっちゃうタイプなのですが
種類豊富な謎解きやしっかりしたストーリー等、
単なるアイテム探しゲームとは全然違う印象がありました。
回転キー操作などの際は前に見つけていたヒントが
主人公の手元メモ的な感じに出てくるので
いちいちメモ書きをしなくても進められるのが良かったです。

日本語化もしっかりしており、主人公の台詞字幕はもちろん
途中で出てくる手紙や壁の文字等もきちんと翻訳されてます。
気になる点としては実績がアンロックされた際
STEAMの通知と一緒にゲーム画面内にも実績のポップアップが出現し、
そこで台詞字幕が隠れてしまうところがあります。
あと、そこまでグロデスクな物ではないのですが
若干のホラー演出があるため小さい子供と一緒にプレーする場合は
注意が必要かもしれません。
